forasticus: <entryFree id="n18541" type="main" key="fo^rasti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>foras</etym>, <sense id="n18541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">out of doors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophorum disciplinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aldh.</author> Septen. Col. 167</bibl></cit> M.</sense></entryFree>
foratus: <entryFree id="n18542" type="main" key="fo^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>foro</etym>, <sense id="n18542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boring</hi> (postclass., and only in the <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">a quo foratu frontem nominatam Varro existimavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurem foratu effeminatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
forbeam: <entryFree id="n18543" type="gloss" key="forbeam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forbeam</orth> <itype>antiqui omne genus cibi appellabant</itype>, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">forbh/n</foreign> vocant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=84" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 84</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
forceps: <entryFree id="n18544" type="main" key="forceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpis</itype> (<sense id="n18544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> forcipium, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 74</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 4</bibl>; <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 277</bibl>) [root in Sanscr. ghar-mas, glow, warmth; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qer-, qe/rmh, qe/ros</foreign>; Lat. for-mus, for-nus, fornax and cap-io], <hi rend="ital">a pair of tongs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pincers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forceps</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">forfex, volsella): forcipem invenit Cinyra Agriopae filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 195</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n18544.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyclopes versant tenaci forcipe ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 175</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">firetongs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 404</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 277</bibl>: uncis forcipibus dentes evelleret, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 74</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">pincers</hi> for drawing teeth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and for other surgical purposes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:26:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 26, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">compressa forcipe lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 556</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu guttura forcipe pressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 78</bibl></cit>: ferrei, <hi rend="ital">iron tongs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hooks attached to a tackle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by firmly grasping a mass of stone or marble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise it aloft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2</bibl> (al. forfices).—</sense><sense id="n18544.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of battlearray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with diverging wings</hi>, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. serra, p. 344 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 18</bibl> (al. forfex).</sense></entryFree>
forctis: <entryFree id="n18545" type="gloss" key="forctis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forctis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. fortis <sense id="n18545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
forculus: <entryFree id="n18546" type="main" key="Forcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Forcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contr. from Foriculus, from 1. foris</etym>, <sense id="n18546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity who presides over the doors</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 15</bibl>; Coron. Mil. 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
forda: <entryFree id="n18547" type="main" key="forda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. fordus.</entryFree>
fordicidia: <entryFree id="n18548" type="gloss" key="fordi^ci_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fordĭcīdĭa</orth> (archaic form ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">hordĭ-cīdia</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll., <sense id="n18548.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>forda + caedo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the sacrifice of a cow that is with calf</hi>, which was performed on the 16th of April, in honor of Tellus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 15</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83</bibl> and 102 Müll., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll. article</ref></xr>.</sense></entryFree>
fordus: <entryFree id="n18549" type="main" key="fordus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fordus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (archaic form <orth extent="full" lang="la">hordus</orth>, <sense id="n18549.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">with young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pregnant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fordicidia a fordis bubus: bos forda quae fert in ventre, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 15</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: fordicidiis boves fordae id est gravidae immolabantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83</bibl> Müll.; and: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia post Veneris cum lux surrexerit Idus. Pontifices, forda sacra litate bove. Forda ferens bos est fecundaque, dicta ferendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:630 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 630 sq.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">forda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a cow that is with calf</hi>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:631" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 631</bibl>.—Archaic form: <cb n="FORI" /> horda praegnans, unde dies, quo gravidae hostiae immolabantur, hordicidia, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
fore: <entryFree id="n18550" type="main" key="fo^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏre</orth>, <sense id="n18550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, irregular, from the obsolete fuo, and equivalent to futurum esse; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrem</orth>, <itype>fores, foret, forent</itype>, <hi rend="ital">subj. imperf.</hi>, equivalent to essem, esses, etc., v. sum <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
forensis: <entryFree id="n18551" type="main" key="fo^rensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>forum</etym>, <sense id="n18551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the market</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forensic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio judicialis et forensis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>delivered in the forum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:170" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 170</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides hoc forense, concertatorium, judiciale non tractavit genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (dicendi) remotum a judiciis forensique certamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:208" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 61, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:272" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 78, 272</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus publicis privatis, forensibus domesticis, tuis amicorum negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res (opp. domesticae litterae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia (opp. domestica),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marte forensi florere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>eloquence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: vestitu forensi ad portam est egressus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in his out-of-door dress</hi> (opp. to housedress), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vestitum, sic sententiam habeas aliam domesticam, aliam forensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutores constituuntur ... feminis, propter forensium rerum ignorantiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">forensia,</quote> <trans><tr>dress of state</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a natura comparata est opera mulieris ad domesticam diligentiam, viri ad exercitationem forensem et extraneam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12 praef.</bibl></cit> § 4.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticus, forensis, negotiator, miles, navigator, medicus, aliud atque aliud efficiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>a public pleader</tr>, <tr>advocate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl>.—With an odious access. notion: ex eo tempore in duas partes discessit civitas: aliud integer populus, fautor et cultor bonorum, aliud forensis factio tenebat, <hi rend="ital">the market-place party</hi> or <hi rend="ital">faction</hi>, i. e. worthless persons who hung about the market-places, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
forentum: <entryFree id="n18552" type="main" key="Fo^rentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fŏrentum</orth> (in some MSS. of Horace <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fĕrentum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n18552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town in Apulia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Forenza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 20, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 16</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fŏrentāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
forfex: <entryFree id="n18553" type="main" key="forfex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forfex</orth>, <itype>fĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>forus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n18553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pair of shears</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scissors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forfices sunt quibus incidimus: forcipes quibus aliquid firmum tenemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiosa grana (in uva), forficibus amputant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 44, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualem (barbam) forficibus metit supinis Tonsor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:95:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 95, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18553.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18553.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A claw</hi> of a crab: <cit><quote lang="la">cancris bina brachia denticulatis forficibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 97</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a locust,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 148</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a beetle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18553.3" n="B" level="2"> Perh., <hi rend="ital">a kind of battle-array</hi>, v. forceps, II.</sense></entryFree>
forficula: <entryFree id="n18554" type="main" key="forfi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forfĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>forfex</etym>, <sense id="n18554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pair of small shears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scissors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod incisum forficulis, cribrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 23, § 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fori: <entryFree id="n18555" type="main" key="fo^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. forus.</entryFree>
foria: <entryFree id="n18556" type="main" key="fo^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the flux</hi>, a disease of swine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">foria stercora liquidiora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 114, 11</bibl></cit>. (Hence, foriolus and conforio.</sense></entryFree>
forica: <entryFree id="n18557" type="hapax" key="fo^ri^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>forum</etym>, <sense id="n18557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public privy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conducunt foricas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. Schol. Vet. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
foricarius: <entryFree id="n18558" type="hapax" key="fo^ri^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>forica</etym>, <sense id="n18558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who rents a</hi> forica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:17:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 1, 17, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
foricula: <entryFree id="n18559" type="hapax" key="fo^ri^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>foris</etym>, <sense id="n18559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a windowshutter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
foricularium: <entryFree id="n18560" type="gloss" key="fo^ri^cu^la_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrĭcŭlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vectigal) [forica], <sense id="n18560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">custom-house duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transit duty</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3347</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
forinsecus: <entryFree id="n18561" type="main" key="fo^rinse^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrinsĕcus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>foris + secus, analogous with extrin-secus</etym>. <sense id="n18561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the outside</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)/cwqen</foreign> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n18561.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab cohorte forinsecus praedictis fenestellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarundam naturae lignum omne corticis loco habent, hoc est forinsecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 42, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non forinsecus, ut cetera, sed interius armavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si actionem diuturnam, quae est forinsecus expedita, perquiras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>publicly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decursae actiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18561.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for foras, <hi rend="ital">out of doors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagis castigatum forinsecus abicit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 138, 33.</sense></entryFree>
forio: <entryFree id="n18562" type="main" key="fo^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>foris</etym>: forire est pro dehonerare ventrem, forire est enim fossas eicere, Schol. Vet. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 38</bibl>. <cb n="FORI" /></entryFree>
foriolus: <entryFree id="n18563" type="hapax" key="fo^ri^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>foria</etym>, <sense id="n18563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has a flux</hi> or <hi rend="ital">diarrhœa</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 114, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
foris: <entryFree id="n18564" type="main" key="fo^ris1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and more freq. in <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. dvār; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qu/ra</foreign>; O. H. Germ. tor; Engl. door, etc.; cf. foras</etym>, <sense id="n18564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a door</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gate;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the two leaves of a door</hi> (syn.: porta, janua, valvae, ostium, limen). </sense><sense id="n18564.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18564.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepuit foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foris crepuit, concrepuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitit ad geminae limina prima foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut lictor forem virgā percuteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum forem cubiculi clauserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forem thalami claudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forem obdere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exclusus fore, cum Longarenus foret intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18564.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo (Jano) fores in liminibus profanarum aedium januae nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pol, haud periculum est, cardines ne foribus effringantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitum prohibe forum et crepitum cardinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a nobis graviter crepuerunt fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fores assistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra fores limenque carceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robustae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invisae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:56" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foribus inest clavis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes incidentes semiapertis portarum foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18564.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the door</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrance</hi> of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">aeneus equus, cujus in lateribus fores essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nassarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 14, 48, § 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18564.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi amicitiae fores aperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis fores apertas intrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18565" type="main" key="fo^ris2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏris</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym><case>abl.</case> form (denoting both the place <hi rend="ital">where</hi> and the place <hi rend="ital">whence</hi>), and answering to the <case>acc.</case> form foras, v. foras <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>. <sense id="n18565.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Out at the doors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out of doors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without</hi> (opp. intus, domi, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">sinito ambulare, si foris, si intus volent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">foris pascuntur, intus opus faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille relictus intus, exspectatus foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 5</bibl></cit>. 17; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: nam et intus paveo, et foris formido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: aliorum intus corpus et foris lignum, ut nucum; <cit><quote lang="la">aliis foris corpus, intus lignum, ut prunis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et intra vallum et foris caederentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi et foris aegre quod sit, satis semper est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut domo sumeret, neu foris quaereret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec minore saevitia foris et in exteros grassatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(consilium petere) foris potius quam domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te foris sapere, tibi non posse te auxiliarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si foris cenat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">venit ad nos Cicero tuus ad cenam, cum Pomponia foris cenaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:6:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 6, § 19</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrinsecus, cum ea, quae sunt foris neque inhaerent in rei natura, colliguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec studia delectant domi, non impediunt foris,</quote> <trans><tr>in public life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ea contentio mihi magnum etiam foris fructum tulisset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>beyond the senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit ille vir cum foris clarus, tum domi admirandus, neque rebus externis magis laudandus quam institutis domesticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et domi dignitas et foris auctoritas retinetur,</quote> <trans><tr>abroad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 136</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi sunt foris arma, nisi est consilium domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 76</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">otium foris, foeda domi lascivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foris valde plauditur,</quote> <trans><tr>among the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egere, foris esse Gabinium, sine provincia stare non posse,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the people's power</tr>, <tr>in debt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18565.1" n="(b)" level="5"> As <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>acc.</case> (late Lat.): constitutus si sit fluvius, qui foris agrum non vagatur, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, Auct. de Limit. p. 273 Goes.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut terminos foris limites ponerentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18565.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">From without</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from abroad</hi>, = extrinsecus: <cit><quote lang="la">at, quaecumque foris veniunt, impostaque nobis Pondera sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quod ea non parit oratoris ars, sed foris ad se delata, tamen arte tractat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 14, 48</bibl></cit>: aut sumere ex sua vi atque natura, aut assumere foris. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 163</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">foris assumuntur ea, quae non sua vi sed extranea sublevantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 40, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 11, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium non petendum est foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 3</bibl></cit>, <pb n="768" /> <cb n="FORM" /> 6: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in ipsa (arte) insit, non foris petatur extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18565.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam in ulcus penetrat omnis a foris injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 227</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
forma: <entryFree id="n18566" type="main" key="forma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. dhar-, dhar-āmi, bear; dhar-i-man, figure; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qra</foreign>- in <foreign lang="greek">qrh=nus, qro/nos</foreign>; cf. Lat. frētus, frēnum, fortis, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n18566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">form</hi>, in the most comprehensive sense of the word, <hi rend="ital">contour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi> (syn.: species, frons, facies, vultus; figura). </sense><sense id="n18566.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18566.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Ha.</hi> Earum nutrix, qua sit facie, mihi expedi. <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Statura haud magna, corpore aquilo. <hi rend="ital">Ha.</hi> Ipsa ea'st. <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Specie venusta, ore parvo, atque oculis pernigris. <hi rend="ital">Ha.</hi> Formam quidem hercle verbis depinxti mihi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 154</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia semper eorum suppeditabatur facies et forma manebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis nostri partes totaque figura et forma et statura, quam apta ad naturam sit, apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si omnium animantium formam vincit hominis figura, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma ac species liberalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:14:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 14, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 27, 76</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:58:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 58, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 26</bibl>: aspicite, o cives, senis Enni imagini' formam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl> (Epigr. 1 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc dico, non ab hominibus formae figuram venisse ad deos ... Non ergo illorum humana forma, sed nostra divina dicenda est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:32:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formaï servare figuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Homeri picturam, non poesin videmus. Quae regio, quae species formaque pugnae, qui motus hominum non ita expictus est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 114</bibl></cit> (v. Moser ad h. l.): <cit><quote lang="la">eximia forma pueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines formā excellente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formā praestante puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma viros neglecta decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 509</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut excellentem muliebris formae pulchritudinem muta in sese imago contineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa aetate venerabilis, haec formae pulchrituline,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem adultam, formā excellentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem maxime formā notam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una et viginti formae litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muralium falcium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanceae novae formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova aedificiorum Urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma et situs agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem cerā aliae atque aliae formae duci solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geometricae formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sit geometria divisa in numeros atque formas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: Archimedes intentus formis, quas in pulvere descripserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 31, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidia circuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 59, 60, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimorum virorum formae,</quote> <trans><tr>figures</tr>, <tr>images</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:32:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 32, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille artifex, cum faceret Jovis formam aut Minervae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">igneae formae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fiery bodies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque tori formam molles sternentur arenae,</quote> <trans><tr>in the shape</tr>, <tr>form</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sacellum) crudis laterculis ad formam camini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 7, 20, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut haec mulier praeter formam nihil ad similitudinem hominis reservarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 70, 199</bibl></cit>.—In <usg type="style">poet.</usg> circumlocution with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: astra tenent caeleste solum formaeque deorum, <hi rend="ital">the forms of gods</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">gods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursi ac formae magnorum luporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae ingentis leo,</quote> <trans><tr>of great size</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18566.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18566.4" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">a fine form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di tibi formam, di tibi divitias dederant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et genus et formam regina pecunia donat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movit Ajacem forma captivae Tecmessae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque, ut laudanda, quae pecuniam suam pluribus largitur, ita quae formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:17" default="NO">5, 12, 17</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">forma bonum fragile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18566.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An outline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi> (of an architect, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum formam videro, quale aedificium futurum sit, scire possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: domus erit egregia; <cit><quote lang="la">magis enim cerni jam poterat, quam quantum ex forma judicabamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit> (2, 6, 2): <cit><quote lang="la">qua ludum gladiatorium aedificaturus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18566.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A model</hi> after which any thing is made, <hi rend="ital">a pattern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stamp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">last</hi> (of a shoemaker), etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">utendum plane sermone, ut numo, cui publica forma est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denarius formae publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: formas quasdam<cb n="FORM" />  nostrae pecuniae agnoscunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">formas binarias, ternarias et quaternarias, et denarias etiam resolvi praecepit neque in usu cujusquam versari,</quote> <trans><tr>stamped money</tr>, <tr>coins</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si scalpra et formas non sutor (emat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 106</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">forma calcei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:5:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 5, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18566.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mould</hi> which gives form to something: <cit><quote lang="la">(caseus) vel manu figuratur vel buxeis formis exprimitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae in quibus aera funduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 49, § 168</bibl></cit>; hence, <hi rend="ital">a frame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">case</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclosure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus tectorium propter excellentiam picturae ligneis formis inclusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formas rivorum perforare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the conduits</tr>, <tr>pipes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 75" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquaeductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n18566.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the aqueduct</hi> itself, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 126" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18566.9" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A rescript</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formulary</hi> (post-class., whereas the dimin. formula is predominant in this signif.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex eorum (amicorum) sententia formas composuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18566.10" n="6" level="3"> Item forma appellatur puls miliacea ex melle, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83</bibl> Müll.</sense><sense id="n18566.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18566.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me quasi formam communium temporum et totius rei publicae misisti expressam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">formam quidem ipsam et tamquam faciem honesti vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innumerabiles quasi formae figuraeque dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:9:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum, quae forma et quasi naturalis nota cujusque sit, describitur, ut, si quaeratur avari species, seditiosi, gloriosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:29:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 29, 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sit in ea species et forma et notio viri boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 20, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:294" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 85, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplar formaque rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma et species et origo tyranni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma rerum publicarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam vitae inire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum vulgarem formam juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:111" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 615</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18566.13" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18566.14" n="1" level="3"> In philos. lang., like species, <hi rend="ital">a sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>: nolim, ne si Latine quidem dici possit, specierum et speciebus dicere; et saepe his casibus utendum est: at formis et formarum velim ... Genus et formam definiunt hoc modo: genus est notio ad plures differentias pertinens; <cit><quote lang="la">forma est notio, cujus differentia ad caput generis et quasi fontem referri potest. Formae igitur sunt hae, in quas genus sine ullius praetermissione dividitur, ut si quis jus in legem, morem, aequitatem dividat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:7:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 7, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus et species, quam eandem formam Cicero vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 62</bibl></cit>: a forma generis, quam interdum, quo planius accipiatur, partem licet nominare, hoc modo, etc. ... Genus enim est uxor; <cit><quote lang="la">ejus duae formae: una matrumfamilias, altera earum, quae tantummodo uxores habentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod haec (partitio) sit totius in partes, illa (divisio) generis in formas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae formae matrimoniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18566.15" n="2" level="3"> In gram. </sense><sense id="n18566.16" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The grammatical quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi> of a word: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo animadvertito, natura quadruplicem esse formam, ad quam in declinando accommodari debeant verba, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=37 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 37 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:101" default="NO">101</bibl> sq. Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18566.17" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The grammatical form</hi> of a word: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum in secunda forma verbum temporale habeat in extrema syllaba AS an IS, ad discernendas dissimilitudines interest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=109" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 109</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">aeditimus ea forma dictum, qua finitimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formabilis: <entryFree id="n18567" type="main" key="forma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>formo</etym>, <sense id="n18567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be formed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fashioned</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1034</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 11, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
formabilitas: <entryFree id="n18568" type="main" key="forma_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>formabilis</etym>, <sense id="n18568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">capacity for being fashioned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plasticity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum materiae quandam, ut ita dicam, formabilitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Gen. ad Lit. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formaceus: <entryFree id="n18569" type="hapax" key="forma_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>forma</etym>, <sense id="n18569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made in a form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mould</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes, quos appellant formaceos, quoniam in forma circumdatis duabus utrimque tabulis inferciuntur verius quam instruuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 48, § 169</bibl></cit>. <cb n="FORM" /></sense></entryFree>
formalis: <entryFree id="n18570" type="main" key="forma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>forma</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n18570.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to forma, I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for a form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mould</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatura aeris,</quote> <trans><tr>proper for making moulds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18570.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to I. B. 4.) </sense><sense id="n18570.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Having a set form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the nature of a rescript</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum procuratorum suorum nomine formalem dictaret epistolam, sic coepit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formalia verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 23, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">observatio (in testamentis faciendis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18570.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (qs. of the nature of a formulary), <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">normal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid formali pretio aestimare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:62:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 62, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formamentum: <entryFree id="n18571" type="main" key="forma_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>formo</etym>, <sense id="n18571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forming;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">a shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia principiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:819" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 819</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formaster: <entryFree id="n18572" type="hapax" key="formaster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formaster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>forma</etym>, <sense id="n18572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who beautifies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorns himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a coxcomb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dandy</hi>: aut luculentaster aut formaster frigidus, Tit. ap. Fest. s. v. OBSTRVDANT, p. 193 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
formatio: <entryFree id="n18573" type="main" key="forma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>formo</etym>, <sense id="n18573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forming; a form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plan</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n18573.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">formationem puto probandam, locum improbandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblonga fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formationes columnarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18573.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formator: <entryFree id="n18574" type="main" key="forma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a former</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashioner</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n18574.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">universi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 44, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18574.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptor rector est alienorum ingeniorum ac formator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animi (with praeceptor virtutis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">4: morum (with magister),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricolae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formatrix: <entryFree id="n18575" type="main" key="forma_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>formator</etym>, <sense id="n18575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who forms</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">regina (Dido) tantae civitatis formatrix,</quote> <trans><tr>foundress</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 17 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
formatura: <entryFree id="n18576" type="main" key="forma_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>formo</etym>, <sense id="n18576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashioning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaping</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">labrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res formatura varia,</quote> <trans><tr>of various shapes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formella: <entryFree id="n18577" type="main" key="formella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>forma</etym>, <sense id="n18577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mould</hi> for baking in (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in formella piscem formare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:9:13" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 9, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or for moulding cheese: casei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 17, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formiae: <entryFree id="n18578" type="main" key="Formi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Formĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for sformiae, <foreign lang="greek">svormiai</foreign>, from old form <foreign lang="greek">*(ormi/ai</foreign>, place of anchorage; cf. <foreign lang="greek">o(/rmos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n18578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient city of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fabled seat of the Laestrygones</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mola di Gaeta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18578.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n18578.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Formĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Formiae</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Formian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus P. Rutilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>spent in Formiae</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:26" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 30, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18578.3" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18578.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Formĭ-ānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a villa in Formiae</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">of Cicero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of C. Laelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Dolabella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18578.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Formĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Formiae</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Formians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
formica: <entryFree id="n18579" type="main" key="formi_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root mur-, to swarm, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mu/rmos, mu/rmhc</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 339 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 339 sq.</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n18579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emmet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pismire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te faciam ut formicae frustillatim differant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 30, 36, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl> (4, 12), 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 186</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">380</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 402</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:33 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 33 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">confit cito, Quam si formicis tu obicias papaverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formicabilis: <entryFree id="n18580" type="main" key="formi_ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>formica</etym>, <sense id="n18580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resembling the creeping of ants</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:27:145" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 27, 145</bibl></cit>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">formīcālis</orth> <itype>pulsus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:198" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 198</bibl>; cf. formicatio and formico, II.</sense></entryFree>
formicatio: <entryFree id="n18581" type="main" key="formi_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>formico</etym>, <sense id="n18581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an irritation of the skin resembling the crawling of ants</hi>, produced by pustules; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">murmhki/a</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 20, § 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum articulorum, qui tanguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 5:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formicinus: <entryFree id="n18582" type="hapax" key="formi_ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>formica</etym>, <sense id="n18582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">like ants</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>creeping</tr>, <tr>crawling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formico: <entryFree id="n18583" type="main" key="formi_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n18583.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To creep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crawl like ants</hi>: venarum inaequali aut <pb n="769" /> <cb n="FORM" /> formicante percussu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 171</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n18583.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To feel like the creeping of ants</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">murmhkizw</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec formicet cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 13, 41, § 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formicosus: <entryFree id="n18584" type="main" key="formi_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>formica</etym>, <sense id="n18584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of ants</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 74, 95, § 206</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formicula: <entryFree id="n18585" type="main" key="formi_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little ant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Ver. 8" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Ver. 8</bibl> ed. Mai.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 240</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
formidabilis: <entryFree id="n18586" type="main" key="formi_da_bi^li^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīdābĭlĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. formido</etym>, <sense id="n18586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formidable</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">formidolosus): lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 857</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec formidabilis ulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:174" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores et metus, per se formidabiles res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 14</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> adverbially: <cit><quote lang="la">formidabile ridens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:582" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 582</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formidamen: <entryFree id="n18587" type="main" key="formi_da_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīdāmen</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a spectre</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bustorum formidamina, sepulcrorum terriculamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 315, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formido: <entryFree id="n18588" type="main" key="formi_do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>v. 2. formido</etym>, <sense id="n18588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dread</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to be afraid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frightened</hi> (class.; syn.: metuo, timeo, vereor, trepido, tremo, paveo). </sense><sense id="n18588.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et illud paveo et hoc formido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum (shortly after: metuo malum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse se cruciat omniaque formidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius iracundiam formidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">a)po/teugma</foreign> formido et timeo, ne, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum formidet te mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acumen judicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnos tepores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 93</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic classe formidatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidata Parthis Roma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautis formidatus Apollo (i. e. the temple of Apollo on the Leucadian promontory),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 275</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec formidatis auxiliatur aquis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the hydrophobia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo etiam satietas formidanda est magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:213" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 213</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18588.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si isti formidas credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec ego naribus uti Formido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus formidat animus, nostrum tam diu ibi sedere filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18588.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem non formido, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 2, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formido miser, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18588.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: auro formidat Euclio: abstrudit foris, <hi rend="ital">fears for the gold</hi>, Plaut. Aul. argum. 6.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male formido, si hera mea sciat tam socordem esse quam sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus paveo et foris formido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne formida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 20</bibl>: neque prius desinam formidare, quam tetigisse te Italiam audiero, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18589" type="main" key="formi_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root dhar-, whence firmus; prop. the fear that makes rigid, Corss.
