Ausspr. 1, 148</etym>, <sense id="n18589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fearfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dread</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n18589.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">parasitus, qui me conplevit flagiti et formidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: popolo formidinem inicere, Furius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoici definiunt formidinem metum permanentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliqua in vita formido improbis esset posita, apud inferos antiqui supplicia constituta esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tanta formido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque miser me commovere possum prae formidine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1</bibl></cit>. 1, 181: <cit><quote lang="la">subita atque improvisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidinem suam alicui inicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:28:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 28, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidinem inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 207</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fustis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 154</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula intendantur, formidines opponantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ignoratione rerum ipsa horribiles exsistunt formidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra formidines pavoresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 29, § 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18589.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">awe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(portae) religione sacrae et saevi formidine Martis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 608</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:83" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18589.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">that which produces fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a frightful thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horror.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18589.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">alta ostia Ditis Et caligantem nigrā formidine lucum Ingressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 468</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Fer. Als. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Fer. Als. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensoribus moenium praemia modo, modo formidinem ostentare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:66:1" default="NO" valid="yes">66, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18589.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a scarecrow</hi> made of differentcolored feathers, <hi rend="ital">a bugbear</hi>: cum maximos <cb n="FORM" /> ferarum greges linea pennis distincta contineat et in insidias agat, ab ipso effectu dicta formido, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de 1ra, 2:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> de 1ra, 2, 12</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 303 sq.</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">cervum puniceae septum formidine pennae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 750</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 437</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furum aviumque Maxima formido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—Personified, as <hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>, Hyg. Fab. prooem. p. 10 Munk.</sense></entryFree>
formidolose: <entryFree id="n18590" type="main" key="formi_do^lo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīdŏlōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. formidulosus <sense id="n18590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
formidulositas: <entryFree id="n18591" type="main" key="formi_du^lo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīdŭlōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>formidulosus</etym>, <sense id="n18591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cruelty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extreme severity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Laud. Mart. p. 134</bibl></cit> ed. Wurzb.</sense></entryFree>
formidulosus: <entryFree id="n18592" type="main" key="formi_du^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formīdŭlōsus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">formīdŏlōsus</orth>, v. Corss. Ausspr. 2, 145), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. formido</etym>, <sense id="n18592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearful.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18592.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producing fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrific</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nimis formidulosum facinus praedicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca tetra, inculta, foeda, formidulosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc locum consessumque vestrum, quem illi horribilem A. Cluentio ac formidulosum fore putaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:55" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu me Scorpius aspicit Formidolosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 17, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae formidolosae dictu, non esu modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubia et formidulosa tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidulosissimum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 24, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 21, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18592.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experiencing fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afraid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timorous</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): mancipia esse oportet neque formidolosa neque animosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num formidolosus, obsecro, es?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:18 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 18 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(boyes) ad ingredienda flumina aut pontes formidolosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 17</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum formidolosiorem hostium credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 62</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">formīdŭlōse</orth>. * </sense><sense id="n18592.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fearfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terribly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 19, 42</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n18592.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fearfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timorously</hi>: formidolosius, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 196</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
formidus: <entryFree id="n18593" type="hapax" key="formi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>‡ formus</etym>, <sense id="n18593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warm</hi>: aedificium aestate frigidum, hieme formidum, Cato ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. forma, p. 83 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
formio: <entryFree id="n18594" type="main" key="formi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. phormio.</entryFree>
formitas: <entryFree id="n18595" type="main" key="formi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>formo</etym>, <sense id="n18595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashioning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forming</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 17, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
formo: <entryFree id="n18596" type="main" key="formo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>forma</etym>, <sense id="n18596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n18596.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: omnis fere materia nondum formata rudis appellatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=265" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 265</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia, quam fingit et format effectio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque temperatus sit aër, ita pueros orientes animari atque formari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsos formare capillos,</quote> <trans><tr>to adjust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem in Ida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e Pario formatum marmore signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 419</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(individua corpora, i. e. atomi) formare, figurare, colorare, animare (se ipsa) non possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:39:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 39, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18596.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct; to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>, etc. (in Cic. only with abstr. objects): <cit><quote lang="la">verba nos, sicut mollissimam ceram, ad nostrum arbitrium formamus et fingimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba recte formare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:7" default="NO">10, 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae inter se discrepant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:180" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam filii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4 praef.</bibl></cit> § 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studia ejus, id. prooem. § 5: consuetudinem partim exercitationis assiduitate partim ratione formare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam et mores juventutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:47:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodireque in aetate prima pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla res magis penetrat in animos, eosque fingit, format, flectit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 38, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae formabat canendo Heroum mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:452" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 452</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores juventutis quam principaliter formas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:47:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 47, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:88:3" default="NO" valid="yes">88, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolas orationesque et edicta alieno formabat ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid res exigeret, Latine formabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventus est ejus de hac re sermo formatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personam formare nevam,</quote> <trans><tr>to invent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 126</bibl></cit>: versus meos cantat formatque citharā, qs. <hi rend="ital">trims</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellishes them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 19, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitet oratorem institui, rem arduam, etiam cum ei formando nihil defuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: (juvenis) ita a me formari et institui cupit, <cb n="FORM" /> ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfectum ora torem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feros cultus hominum recentum dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenerae nimis mentes asperioribus formandae studiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtam (with alere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">format enim natura prius nos intus ad omnem Fortunarum habitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad credendum ante formatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:14" default="NO">7, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus movendi judicum animos atque in eum quem volumus habitum formandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:2" default="NO">11, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at quae non tacita formavi gaudia mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in mores alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: in admirationem formata, i. e. <hi rend="ital">feigning</hi>, simulans, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
formose: <entryFree id="n18597" type="main" key="formo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. formosus <sense id="n18597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
formositas: <entryFree id="n18598" type="main" key="formo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>formosus</etym>, <sense id="n18598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beauty</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">uxor eximia formositate praedita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 224, 24</bibl></cit>: decorum positum est in tribus rebus, formositate, ordine, ornatu ad actionem apto, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
formosulus: <entryFree id="n18599" type="main" key="formo_su^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formōsŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n18599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">pretty</hi> (ante- and post-class.): uxor, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 27, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">formosulus tuus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 117, 10</bibl></cit>: formosuli nostri, id. ap. Jovin. 2, 14.</sense></entryFree>
formosus: <entryFree id="n18600" type="main" key="formo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formōsus</orth> (FORMONSVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 669, 10</bibl>; <sense id="n18600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">FORMONSIOR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 374</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 169: <cit><quote lang="la">formonsam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 5</bibl></cit> Rib.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>forma, I. B. 1.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">finely formed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handsome</hi> (freq. and class; syn.: pulcher, speciosus, venustus, bellus). </sense><sense id="n18600.1" n="A" level="2"> Of visible subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">deum rotundum esse volunt, quod ea forma ullam negat esse pulchriorem Plato: at mihi vel cylindri vel quadrati vel coni vel pyramidis videtur esse formosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consideratur in homine, formosus an deformis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines formosissimae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis formosa videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formosum pastor Corydon ardebat Alexin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">formosi pecoris custos, formosior ipse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galatea hedera formosior alba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater haedorum duorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma Sabina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 32; so, <cit><quote lang="la">formosius telum jaculabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Müll. felicius): Alcibiades, omnium aetatis suae multo formosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc frondent sylvae, nunc formosissimus annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus (i. e. ver),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:129" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas messibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux formosior omnibus Calendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:24:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus formosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Formonsa facies muta commendatio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:169" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 169</bibl></cit> (Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n18600.2" n="B" level="2"> Rarely of abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est virtute formosius, nihil pulchrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">formōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">beautifully</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Cupidinem formosum deum formose cubantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>, p. 183: <cit><quote lang="la">formosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formosissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formucales: <entryFree id="n18601" type="gloss" key="formucales"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formucales</orth> <itype>forcipes dictae, quod forma capiant, id est ferventia</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=91" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 91</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n18601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (acc. to Scalig. to be read ‡ formucapes).</sense></entryFree>
formula: <entryFree id="n18602" type="main" key="formu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>forma, I. B.</etym>, acc. to the different signiff. of forma. * <sense id="n18602.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">A fine form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formula atque aetatula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18602.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to forma, I. B. 2.) </sense><sense id="n18602.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small pattern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mould</hi>, <hi rend="ital">last</hi>, acc. to which any thing is formed: <cit><quote lang="la">calcei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18602.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any thing made in a mould</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a form</hi>, of cheese: <cit><quote lang="la">solidatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mai. 9, 2</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n18602.4" n="III" level="1"> (Acc. to forma, I. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">A conduit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pipe</hi> of an aqueduct, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 36" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 36</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18602.5" n="IV" level="1"> (Acc. to forma, I. B. 4.) Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">method</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formula</hi> for regulating judicial proceedings (the usual meaning; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">norma, regula, praescriptum): ut stipulationum et judiciorum formulas componam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in testamentorum formulis, hoc est, in medio jure civili versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">antiquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:52:195" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 52, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:60:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 60, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustissima sponsionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiduciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de dolo malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 14, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa gloria militaris vestris formulis atque actionibus anteponenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 13, 29 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt jura, sunt formulae de omnibus rebus constitutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: a praetore postulat, ut sibi Quinctius judicatum solvi <pb n="770" /> <cb n="FORN" /> satis det ex formula: <cit><quote lang="la">QVOD AB EO PETAT, CVIVS EX EDICTO PRAETORIS BONA DIES XXX. POSSESSA SINT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in foro atrocitate formularum dijudicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis hanc formulam cognitionis esse, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>the rule of evidence on which the inquiry is conducted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 12, 20</bibl></cit>.— On the formulae of actions, constituting a sort of code of procedure, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:30" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 30</bibl>-48; and on the legal forms of the Romans in general, cf. Rein's Röm. Privatr. p. 440 sq.—</sense><sense id="n18602.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18602.7" n="I" level="1"> In gen., for causa, <hi rend="ital">a lawsuit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">process</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim aliud agitis, cum eum, quem interrogatis, scientes in fraudem impellitis, quam ut formulā cecidisse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 48" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formulā cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 69</bibl></cit> (for which, in Cic., causā cadere): <cit><quote lang="la">formulā excidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18602.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">for mula letalis,</quote> <trans><tr>a death-warrant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18602.9" n="3" level="3"> Beyond the legal sphere. </sense><sense id="n18602.10" n="a" level="4"> In publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">any form of contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acarnanas restituturum se in antiquam formulam jurisque ac dicionis eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24, 6</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">citaverunt legatos, quaesiveruntque ab iis, ecquid milites ex formula paratos haberent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 10, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos in sociorum formulam referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oppidum) Paracheloïda, quae sub Athamania esset, nullo iure Thessalorum formulae factam (= inique juris Thessalorum factum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18602.11" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sine ullo errore dijudicare possimus, si quando cum illo, quod honestum intelligimus, pugnare id videbitur, quod appellamus utile, formula quaedam constituenda est ... erit autem haec formula Stoicorum rationi disciplinaeque maxime consentanea, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:19 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 4, 19 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa quaedam disciplinae formula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formulam exprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusque generis nota et formula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinis nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 7, 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18602.12" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">natio redacta in formulam provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:28:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 28, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formularius: <entryFree id="n18603" type="hapax" key="formu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>formula, II. C.</etym>, <sense id="n18603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lawyer skilled only in composing writs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forms of process in courts of law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii se ad album ac rubricas transtulerunt et formularii vel, ut Cicero ait, leguleii quidam esse maluerunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
formus: <entryFree id="n18604" type="gloss" key="formus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">formus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ferv-veo; Sanscr. ghar-mas, glow, warmth; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qermo/s, qe/ros</foreign>; Lat. ferveo, fornus, fornax; O. H. Germ. waram; <cit><quote lang="la">Engl. warm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 485" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 485</bibl></cit></etym>, <sense id="n18604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warm</hi> (ante-class.): forma significat modo faciem cujusque rei, modo calida, ut, cum exta, quae dantur, deforma appellantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">forcipes dicuntur, quod his forma, id est calida capiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=84" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">‡ formucales (Scal. ‡ formucapes) forcipes dictae, quod forma capiant, id est ferventia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=91" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fornacalis: <entryFree id="n18605" type="main" key="forna_ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornācālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fornax</etym>, <sense id="n18605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to ovens.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18605.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: dea, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the goddess</hi> Fornax (v. fornax, II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:314" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 314</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18605.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fornācālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of the goddess</hi> Fornax, <hi rend="ital">instituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to the fable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by Numa; the oven</hi> or <hi rend="ital">baking festival</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 2, 2, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:527" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 527</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83</bibl> and 93 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
fornacarius: <entryFree id="n18606" type="main" key="forna_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornācārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">furn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a furnace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a furnace-heater</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27, § 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fornacator: <entryFree id="n18607" type="main" key="forna_ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornācātor</orth> (FVRNACATOR in an inscr. found at Pompeii, v. Rosin. Dissert. Isag. p. 66, tab. 10, <sense id="n18607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 2), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the heater of a bath-furnace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bath-heater</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fornacula: <entryFree id="n18608" type="main" key="forna_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornācŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little furnace</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oven.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18608.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:82" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 2</bibl> ed. Mai. —*</sense><sense id="n18608.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kindler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exciter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic totius calumniae fornacula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 321, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fornax: <entryFree id="n18609" type="main" key="fornax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf.: fornus and furnus, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pu=r</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n18609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furnace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kiln</hi> (cf. also: <cit><quote lang="la">caminus, clibanus, focus): in ardentibus fornacibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 36, 42, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 148</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">recoquunt patrios fornacibus enses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balinei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:58" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 58</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf. of Aetna: <cit><quote lang="la">vastae Aetnae fornaces,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>craters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidimus undantem ruptis fornacibus Aetnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sulfureis ardet fornacibus Aetne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15</bibl></cit>, <cb n="FORS" /> 340.—</sense><sense id="n18609.1" n="II" level="1"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fornax</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess that presided over ovens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ovengoddess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for whom Numa is said to have instituted an especial festival</hi> (v. fornacalis, II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:525 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 525 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fornicarius: <entryFree id="n18610" type="main" key="forni^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">fornĭcārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fornix, II.</etym>, <sense id="n18610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fornicator; a prostitute</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pudic. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 53, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:57:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 57, 3 al.</bibl>: fornicaria <foreign lang="greek">po/rnh a)po\ kama/ras</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
fornicatim: <entryFree id="n18611" type="hapax" key="forni^ca_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornĭcātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>fornicatus</etym>, <sense id="n18611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the form of an arch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">archwise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 81, § 223</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fornicatio: <entryFree id="n18612" type="main" key="forni^ca_ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vaulting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arching over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arch</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">parietum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:53" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18613" type="main" key="forni^ca_ti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fornicor</etym>, <sense id="n18613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">whoredom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fornication</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>; 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:14:33 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 14, 33 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fornicator: <entryFree id="n18614" type="main" key="forni^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fornicator</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl>. Cor. 5, 11 al.</sense></entryFree>
fornicatrix: <entryFree id="n18615" type="main" key="forni^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fornicator</etym>, <sense id="n18615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fornicatress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostitute</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fornicatus: <entryFree id="n18616" type="main" key="forni^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fornix, I.</etym>, <sense id="n18616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vaulted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arched.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18616.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">paries vel solidus vel fornicatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 5, 11, § 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18616.2" n="II" level="1"> As an <hi rend="ital">adj. prop.</hi>: Via Fornicata, or <hi rend="ital">Arch Street</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a street in Rome leading to the</hi> Campus Martius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 36, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fornicor: <entryFree id="n18617" type="main" key="forni^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n18617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id. II.], <hi rend="ital">to commit whoredom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fornication</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:38:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 38, 24</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
fornix: <entryFree id="n18618" type="main" key="fornix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an arch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vault</hi> (cf.: camera, testudo, tholus, lacunar). </sense><sense id="n18618.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Democritus invenisse dicitur fornicem, ut lapidum curvatura paulatim inclinatorum medio saxo alligaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis in pariete communi demoliendo damni infecti promiserit, non debebit praestare, quod fornix vitii fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 16, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua fornicibus structis perducta (Romam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 24, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspicio adverso fornice portas,</quote> <trans><tr>the entrance under the archway over against us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornices in muro erant apti ad excurrendum,</quote> <trans><tr>vaulted openings from which to make sallies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a covered way</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 11, 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">the arches of heaven</hi>: caeli ingentes fornices, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 19</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 423 ed. Vahl.), a figure found fault with by Cicero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18618.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fornix Făbĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a triumphal arch built by</hi> Q. Fabius Allobrogicus <hi rend="ital">in the</hi> Sacra Via, <hi rend="ital">near the</hi> Regia. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 67</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Fornix Fabianus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">Arcus Fabianus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 1</bibl></cit>); and: <cit><quote lang="la">Fornix Fabii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 267</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker's Antiq. 1, p. 239 sq.—</sense><sense id="n18618.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a brothel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bagnio</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stew</hi>, situated in underground vaults, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:30 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 30 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:156" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:171" default="NO">11, 171</bibl>.—Hence, transf., of one who gave himself up to prostitution: <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesarem) Curio stabulum Nicomedis et Bithynicum fornicem dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fornus: <entryFree id="n18619" type="main" key="fornus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fornus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. furnus <sense id="n18619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
foro: <entryFree id="n18620" type="main" key="fo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root bhar-, Zend. bar-, cut, bore; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">far-, fa/ros</foreign>, plough; cf. <foreign lang="greek">fa/ragc, fa/rugc</foreign>; Germ. bohren; Angl.-Sax. borian; Engl. bore</etym>, <sense id="n18620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce</hi> (mostly post-Aug. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n18620.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">forata arbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene foratas habere aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">o carnificum cribrum, quod credo fore: Ita te forabunt patibulatum per vias Stimulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18620.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: forati animi, <hi rend="ital">full of holes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that retain nothing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
forojuliensis: <entryFree id="n18621" type="main" key="Forojuliensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Forojuliensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Forum Julii, under forum <sense id="n18621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
forpex: <entryFree id="n18622" type="main" key="forpex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forpex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corrupted from forfex</etym>, <sense id="n18622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fire-tongs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Epith. 15, 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fors: <entryFree id="n18623" type="main" key="fors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fors</orth>, <itype>fortis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fero, to bring, whence fortuna, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 300 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 300 sq.</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n18623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hazard.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18623.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18623.2" n="A" level="2"> As an appellative noun (used only in the <case>nom.</case> and <case>abl.</case>; syn.: fortuna, casus, sors): quo saxum impulerit fors, eo cadere Fortunam autumant, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 23, 36</bibl> <cb n="FORS" /> (Trag. Rel. v. 368 Rib., who regards this verse as spurious); cf.: quibus natura prava magis quam fors aut fortuna obfuit, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 425, 13</bibl> (Trag. Rel. ed. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> v. 110</bibl>): cui parilem fortuna locum fatumque tulit fors, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 425, 15</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: casumque timent quem cuique ferat fors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:983" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 983</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum hoc scio: Quod fors feret, feremus aequo animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec, ut fors tulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec fors viderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 10, 1: quam sibi sortem Seu ratio dederit, seu fors objecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia tam incommode illis fors obtulerat adventum meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum quod cuique fors offerebat, arripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte quadam divinitus super ripas Tiberis effusus lenibus stagnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fors fuit, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>it happened that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fors fuat pol!</quote> <trans><tr>so be it! God grant it!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">post-class.: fors fuat, ut his remediis convalescamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16</bibl>: fors fuat, an, etc., <hi rend="ital">it might so happen that; perchance</hi>, i. q. forsitan, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:39" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:28" default="NO">4, 28</bibl> and 29; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: pretio fors fuat officiove, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>perhaps</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 7</bibl></cit> (but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 486</bibl>, v. Lachm. ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n18623.3" n="B" level="2"> Personified, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fors</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of chance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea Fors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:775" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 775</bibl></cit>; also in the connection Fors Fortuna, whose temple was situated on the Tiber, outside of the city: vosne velit an me regnare, era quidve ferat Fors, Virtute experiamur, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 203 ed. Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">sit sane Fors domina campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fors, in quo incerti casus significantur magis (different from Fortuna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed de illa ambulatione Fors viderit, aut si qui est qui curet deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies Fortis Fortunae appellatus ab Servio Tullio rege, quod is fanum Fortis Fortunae secundum Tiberim extra urbem Romam dedicavit Junio mense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 17</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.; <cit><quote lang="la">aedis Fortis Fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 46, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortunae Fortis honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:773" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 773</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Fortuna! o Fors Fortuna! quantis commoditatibus hunc onerastis diem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit> (quoted by Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 425, 19</bibl>; for <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 7, 18</bibl>, v. II. B. 1. infra).</sense><sense id="n18623.4" n="II" level="1"> Adverb., in the <case>nom.</case> and <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n18623.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">fors</orth>, ellipt., for fors sit, it might happen, i. e. <hi rend="ital">perchance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perhaps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peradventure</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">similiter fors, cum sit nominativus, accipitur pro adverbio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1015</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">et fors aequatis cepissent praemia rostris, Ni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 232</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 535</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cesserit Ausonio si fors victoria Turno,</quote> <trans><tr>if perchance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:665" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 665</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 2</bibl>.—Esp. in the connection fors et, i. q. fortasse etiam, <hi rend="ital">perhaps too</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste quod est, ego saepe fui, sed fors et in hora Hoc ipso ejecto carior alter erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nunc ille quidem spe multum captus inani, Fors et vota facit cumulatque altaria donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fors et Debita jura vicesque superbae Te maneant ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 4</bibl>.—Less freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">fors etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:620" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 620</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18623.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">forte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by accident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">casually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accidentally;</hi> freq. with casu, temere, fortuna (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n18623.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est tandem, quod casu fieri aut forte fortuna putemus? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte fortuna per impluvium huc despexi in proximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 75</bibl>: aut forte omnino ac fortuna vincere bello: Si forte et temere omnino, quid cursum ad honorem? Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 425, 16 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte, temere, casu aut pleraque fierent aut omnia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi ista casu nonnumquam, forte, temere concurrerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:68:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 68, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam saepe forte temere Eveniunt, quae non audeas optare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam raptim aut forte temere egeritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: perpulere, ut forte temere in adversos montes erigeret, 2, 31, 5; 25, 38, 12; <cit><quote lang="la">39, 15, 11: quibus forte temere humana negotia volvi persuasum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivi quidam pars forte pars consilio oblati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumque hoc vel forte, vel providentia, vel utcumque constitutum rerum naturae corpus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:66:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 66, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi haec et talia audienti in incerto judicium est, fatone res mortalium et necessitate immutabili, an forte volvantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> A, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <pb n="771" /> <cb n="FORS" /> si adhuc dubium fuisset, forte casuque rectores terris, an aliquo numine darentur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:1:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu dolo seu forte surrexerit, parum compertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seu forte seu tentandi causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec advertit Tiberius forte an quia audiverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum casu diebus iis itineris faciendi causa, Puteolos forte venissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:26:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 26, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cenatum forte apud Vitellios esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi cum stipendium forte militibus daretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte aspicio militem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fit forte obviam mihi Phormio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus ut ibat forte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte ut assedi in stega,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernam forte oblitus fueram exstinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte evenit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 51, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarenti ludi forte erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat forte brumae tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pernox forte luna erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per eos forte dies consul copias Larisam ducere tribunos militum jussit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>it came to pass on one of those days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per eosdem forte dies, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 34, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locum tribuni plebis forte demortui candidatum se ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl></cit>. —So nearly = aliquando (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">forte per angustam tenuis vulpecula rimam repserat in cumeram frumenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibam forte via sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:54:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 54, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte quondam in disponendo mane die praedixerat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:de Caes. 17:5" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> de Caes. 17, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18623.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, to denote uncertainty, corresp. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">perhaps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perchance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peradventure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18623.9" n="a" level="4"> In conditional and causal sentences. </sense><sense id="n18623.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae si quae forte eveniunt hujusmodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis vestrum, judices, aut eorum qui assunt, forte miratur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hicine vir usquam, nisi in patria, morietur? aut, si forte, pro patria?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:38:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 38, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte est domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte eos primus aspectus mundi conturbaverat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te Latina forte deficient,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui me forte locus admonuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quae te forte res aliquando offenderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si forte ceciderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando, si forte, tibi visus es irasci alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 38</bibl></cit> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 47</bibl>.—Rarely <hi rend="ital">forte si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte si tussire occepsit, ne sic tussiat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita demum novatio fit ... forte si condicio vel sponsor vel dies adiciatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:177" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 177</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">protinus Aeneas celeri certare sagitta invitat qui forte velint, i. e. si qui forte velint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A, 5, 485</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18623.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi> ironically: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc te monitum, nisi forte ipse non vis, volueram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo fere saltat sobrius, nisi forte insanit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propensior benignitas esse debebit in calamitosos, nisi forte erunt digni calamitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 18, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 24, 93</bibl>: is constantiam teneat; <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte se intellexerit errasse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negare hoc, nisi forte negare omnia constituisti, nullo modo potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:64:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 64, § 149</bibl></cit>: accedam ad omnia tua, Torquate; <cit><quote lang="la">nisi memoria forte defecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>.—In indirect locution with an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte clarissimo cuique plures curas, majora pericula subeunda, delenimentis curarum et periculorum carendum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl></cit>.— Ironically, <hi rend="ital">unless indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unless to be sure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erucii criminatio tota, ut arbitror, dissoluta est, nisi forte exspectatis, ut illa diluam, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">immo vero te audiamus, nisi forte Manilius interdictum aliquod inter duo soles putat esse componendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortum quidem amicitiae videtis nisi quid ad haec forte vultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:64:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 64, § 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:16:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 16, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18623.12" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid animae forte amittat dormiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit> and 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem ab Aesculapio Petas, ne forte tibi eveniat magnum malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui metuo, ne te forte flagitent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuens, ne forte deprehensus retraheretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comperisse me non audeo dicere, ne forte id ipsum verbum ponam, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>: ac ne forte <cb n="FORS" /> hoc magnum ac mirabile esse videatur, hominem toties irasci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 18, 2</bibl>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">ut non</hi> instead of <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18623.13" n="b" level="4"> In relat. clauses (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nisi si quispiamst Amphitruo alius, qui forte te hic absente tamen tuam rem curet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus in hoc non est populo, qui forte Latine reddere verba queat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam qui forte Stichum et Erotem emerit, recte videtur ita demonstrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:59" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 10:3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:39:45" default="NO">39, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18623.14" n="c" level="4"> In gen. (rare; not in Cic., for in Off. 2, 20, 70, the true read. is: in uno illo aut, si forte, in liberis ejus manet gratia, B. and K.; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the corrupt passage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Att. 10:12:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 12, 5</bibl></cit>;
