Orelli reads: fortiter ac tempestive; <cit><quote lang="la">Kayser, fortiter vel cum tempestate): quid si apud te veniat de subito prandium aut potatio Forte, aut cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum alium pro alio pedem metrorum ratio non recipit, sed ne dactylum quidem aut forte spondeum alterum pro altero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive non trino forte nundino promulgata, sive non idoneo die, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sciant, an ad probandum id quod intendimus forte respondeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 122</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 20</bibl>: quo casu licet uxori vel in omnes res, vel in unam forte aut duas (optare), Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 150</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte quid expediat, communiter aut melior pars Malis carere quaeritis laboribus,</quote> <trans><tr>what may perhaps be of some use</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii nulli rem obligatam esse quam forte Lucio Titio,</quote> <trans><tr>than for instance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:15:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 1, 15, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:67" default="NO">30, 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:22:7:section=6" default="NO">48, 22, 7, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:179" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
forsan: <entryFree id="n18624" type="main" key="forsan"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fors-an</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ellipt. for fors sit an; v. fors, II. A. and forsitan, and cf. fortan and fortassean</etym>, <sense id="n18624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perhaps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perchance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peradventure</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">me miseram, forsan hic mihi parvam habeat fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 729</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forsan et haec olim meminisse juvabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 203</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">forsan miseros meliora sequentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic uni forsan potui succumbere culpae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mihi forsan tibi quod negarit, Porriget hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernicies Tibi paratur, forsan et miserae mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transierant binae forsan trinaeve Calendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:75:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 75, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem decreto sermonem praetenderit, forsan aliquem verum auctores antiqui tradiderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:39:14" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 39, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occurrat mihi forsan aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:31" default="NO">12, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tu forsan audire nolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit> (dub. v. Zumpt ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 11</bibl>).—In law Lat., <hi rend="ital">as for example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for instance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:34:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 34, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
forsit: <entryFree id="n18625" type="hapax" key="forsit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forsit</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from fors sit; cf. fors, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n18625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perhaps</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 49</bibl> (quoted <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1015</bibl> P.).</sense></entryFree>
forsitan: <entryFree id="n18626" type="main" key="forsi^tan"><orth extent="full" lang="la">forsĭtan</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from fors sit an; v. fors, A.; cf. also: forsan, fortan, and fortassean</etym>, <sense id="n18626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perhaps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peradventure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18626.1" n="I" level="1"> Usually in principal clauses. </sense><sense id="n18626.2" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (class. and freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">only so in Cicero): si altera illaec magis instabit, forsitan nos reiciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longiorem orationem causa forsitan postulet, tua certe natura breviorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 12, 38</bibl></cit> (al. fortasse postulat, v. Halm. ad loc.): <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan quaeratis, qui iste terror sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 288</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan quispiam dixerit: Nonne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 29</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse dixerit quispiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 3, 8</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan occurrat illud, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">major ars aliqua forsitan esset requirenda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 45, 189</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 15, 67: illud forsitan quaerendum sit, num, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:45:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 45, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsa forsitan fuerint non necessaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 13, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan meliores illi accusatores habendi sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium forsitan haec illi mirentur atque efferant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 56</bibl></cit>, § 124.—With <hi rend="ital">sed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae forsitan vobis parvae esse videantur: sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl>; so with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 25, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae forsitan laus sit, verum tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan dicatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 31, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem insimulare forsitan fas non sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 38, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18626.3" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): forsitan et publica, sua certe liberata fide, in castra redierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 23, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipies forsitan justus esse rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan non periculosius est tacere quam dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:20" default="NO">4, 14, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40</bibl>: forsitan haec aliquis,<cb n="FORT" />  nam sunt quoque, parva vocabit, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 419</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan ventos timebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18626.4" n="II" level="1"> In dependent clauses (rare), with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque id facio, ut quibusdam forsitan videor, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videor jam liberius loqui debere quam forsitan ipsi velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: decrevi ad te scribere, quod forsitan minus ea perspicias, Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minime consentaneum est, cum bello tuo forsitan vix sufficias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 18, 3</bibl></cit> (but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 610</bibl>, where the correct read. is forsitan e rosea, etc.; v. Lachm. p. 302).</sense></entryFree>
fortan: <entryFree id="n18627" type="hapax" key="fortan"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortan</orth>, false read. for jam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 47</bibl>.</entryFree>
fortasse: <entryFree id="n18628" type="main" key="fortasse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortassē</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">fortassis</orth>, <itype>but rarely</itype>, and not in Caes.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:52:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 52, 144</bibl> Klotz, B. and K.; 71, 201 B. and K.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 20, 18, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:102" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 77, § 102</bibl>; Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:12:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 12, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:14:section=9" default="NO">11, 7, 14, § 9</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>forte an; cf.: forsan, fortan</etym>, <sense id="n18628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perhaps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peradventure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possibly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis tu fortasse, apud nos facinus quod natum est novum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam me hercule, et contemnar a te fortasse, cum tu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (genere) esse videbuntur fortasse angustiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse dices: Quid ergo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requiretur fortasse nunc, quemadmodum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeret fortassis quispiam, displiceatur mihi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:52:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 52, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse dixerit quispiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 3, 8</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan quispiam dixerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 29</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec longiora fortasse fuerunt quam necesse, fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustines enim non parvam exspectationem imitandae industriae nostrae, magnam honorum, nonnullam fortasse nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poterimus fortasse dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tamen fortasse non nollem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Lucullus, qui tamen aliqua ex parte iis incommodis mederi fortasse potuisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum, inquies, et fortasse fatuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">otioso et loquaci et fortasse docto atque erudito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 102</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclaram illam quidem fortasse, sed a vita hominum abhorrentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Marso fortasse, sed Romano facillimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:33:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 33, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 30</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi> (for nisi forte): <cit><quote lang="la">tu hoc: alius fortasse, quod in animadversione poenaque durior, nisi fortasse utrumque tu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sed tamen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 5, 12</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">verum tamen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 28</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">quidem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id nos fortasse non perfecimus, conati quidem saepissime sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:210" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 62, 210</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res enim fortasse verae, certe graves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18628.1" n="b" level="4"> In Plaut. and Ter. ellipt., like fors, with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse te illum mirari cocum, Quod venit atque haec attulit,</quote> <trans><tr>it may be that</tr>, <tr>perhaps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 33</bibl>; cf.: sic Plautus: Fortasse ted amare suspicarier. Nam veteres infinitivo modo adjungebant fortasse, Don. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; cf. ellipt. use: <hi rend="ital">Q.</hi> unum illud mihi videris imitari, orationis genus. <hi rend="ital">M.</hi> Velle fortasse; <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim id potest imitari?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18628.2" n="c" level="4"> Ironically (cf. forte, 2, a. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)/sws</foreign>): <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Prorsum nihil intellego. <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Hui, tardus es. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Fortasse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ego fortasse vaticinor, et haec omnia meliores habebunt exitus ... eos ego fortasse nunc imitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18628.3" n="d" level="4"> In designating numbers, <hi rend="ital">about</hi> (in Cic. usually placed after the numeral): <cit><quote lang="la">elegit ex multis Isocratis libris triginta fortasse versus Hieronymus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:190" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Pompeius biennio quam nos fortasse major,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:240" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 68, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">HS. D. milia fortasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuimus una horas duas fortasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse circiter triennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercaris agrum, fortasse trecentis, aut etiam supra, nummorum milibus emptum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fortassean: <entryFree id="n18629" type="main" key="fortassean"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortasse-an</orth> (sometimes written separately fortasse an), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>cf.: forsan, forsitan, fortan</etym>, <sense id="n18629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perhaps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perchance</hi> (ante- and post-class.): fortassean sit, quos hic non mertet metus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 33</bibl>; Sisenn. <pb n="772" /> <cb n="FORT" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 82, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de fructo, inquit, hoc dico, quod fortassean tibi satis sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:6:1" default="NO">3, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse an pantherae quoque et leones non Africae bestiae dicerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 7, § 40</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortassean dixerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea omnia comtius fortasse an dici potuerunt, fortius potuisse dici non videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:6" default="NO">19, 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fortassis: <entryFree id="n18630" type="main" key="fortassis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortassis</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fortasse <sense id="n18630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fortax: <entryFree id="n18631" type="greek" key="fortax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fo/rtac</foreign> (bearer), <sense id="n18631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the basis</hi> on which a furnace rests, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 38, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
forte: <entryFree id="n18632" type="main" key="forte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fors, II. B.</entryFree>
fortesco: <entryFree id="n18633" type="hapax" key="fortesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n18633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [fortis], <hi rend="ital">to become brave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">item notavimus, quod fortescere posuit (Laevius) pro fortem fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
forticulus: <entryFree id="n18634" type="main" key="forti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n18634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brave</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">resolute</hi> (very rare): quamvis idem (Epicurus) forticulum se in torminibus praebeat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 19, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 212, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fortificatio: <entryFree id="n18635" type="main" key="forti^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fortifico</etym>, <sense id="n18635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strengthening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortifying</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpori adhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:44" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fortifico: <entryFree id="n18636" type="main" key="forti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fortis - facio</etym>, <sense id="n18636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortify</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:7:91" default="NO">3, 7, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes (with constringere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 2:4:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fortis: <entryFree id="n18637" type="main" key="fortis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortis</orth> (archaic form FORCTIS, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. Fest. s. v. sanates, p. 348 Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=84" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 84</bibl>; and perh. also in the form FORCTUS; v. id. s. v. horctum, p. 102; cf. Müll. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=320" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 320</bibl>, b), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. dhar-; v. forma, firmus</etym>, <sense id="n18637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18637.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: firmus, strenuus, incolumis, animosus): ecquid fortis visa est (mulier),</quote> <trans><tr>powerful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">set Bacchis etiam fortis tibi vissast?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: sicut fortis equus, spatio qui saepe supremo Vicit Olympia, nunc senio confectus quiescit, <hi rend="ital">a powerful horse</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 5, 14</bibl> (Ann. v. 441 ed. Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:764" default="NO" valid="yes">764</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:987" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 987</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 705</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae pingue solum ... Fortes invortant tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contingat modo te filiamque tuam fortes invenire,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hearty</tr>, <tr>well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antecedebat testudo pedum LX., facta item ex fortissimis lignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ligna fortissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invalidissimum urso caput, quod leoni fortissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiores stomachi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 26, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantae fortiores fient,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiorem illum (pontem) tueri, Auct. B. Alex. 19, 2: castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiora remedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:434" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 34</bibl></cit>: sol (with medius), <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 588" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Med. 588</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiora ad hiemes frumenta, legumina in cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vites) contra pruinas fortissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18637.2" n="II" level="1"> Mentally, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadfast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courageous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manly</hi>, etc., answering to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)ndrei=os</foreign> (very freq. in all periods and sorts of composition). </sense><sense id="n18637.3" n="A" level="2"> Of human beings: fortis et constantis est, non perturbari in rebus asperis nec tumultuantem de gradu deici, ut dicitur; <cit><quote lang="la">sed praesenti animo uti et consilio, nec a ratione discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 23, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperantia libidinem (aspernatur), ignaviam fortitudo: itaque videas rebus injustis justos maxime dolere, imbellibus fortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores fortes et animosos et se acriter ipsos morti offerentes servare cupimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus angustis animosus atque Fortis appare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri fortes et magnanimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir fortis et acris animi magnique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni et fortes et magno animo praediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientissimi et fortissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir liber ac fortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum omnium fortissimi sunt Belgae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissimus vir,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; 2, 33, 4; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 20, 2: hunc liberta securi Divisit medium, fortissima Tyndaridarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis recte vivere? quis non? Si virtus hoc una potest dare, fortis omissis Hoc age deliciis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep 1, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu quis capit acria fortis Pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 69</bibl></cit>: cavit, ne umquam infamiae ea res sibi esset, ut virum fortem decet, <hi rend="ital">an honorable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worthy man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 13</bibl>; <cb n="FORT" /> cf.: FORCTIS frugi et bonus, sive validus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=84" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 84</bibl> Müll.; and: <cit><quote lang="la">HORCTUM et FORCTUM pro bono dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hoc nequeo mirari satis, Eum sororem despondisse suam in tam fortem familiam ... Familiam optimam occupavit,</quote> <trans><tr>so respectable</tr>, <tr>honorable a family</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">(cf. bonus): vir ad pericula fortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum erant tam fortes ad sanguinem civilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir contra audaciam fortissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 85</bibl></cit>: vidi in dolore podagrae hospitem meum fortiorem, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 527, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator in proeliis strenuus et fortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum fortem ac strenuum scio dixisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fortes fueritis in eo, quem nemo sit ausus defendere,</quote> <trans><tr>if you had proceeded with vigor</tr>, <tr>energy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugacibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 543</bibl></cit>; and with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortis et asperas Tractare serpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemnere honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum spernere fortior Quam cogere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 3, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:906" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 906</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortes fortuna adjuvat,</quote> <trans><tr>fortune favors the brave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortes enim non modo fortuna adjuvat, ut est in vetere proverbio, sed multo magis ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: audendum est; <cit><quote lang="la">fortes adjuvat ipsa Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: fortibus est fortuna viris data, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 262 ed. Vahl.; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: audentes fortuna iuvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 284</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">audentes deus ipse juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 586</bibl></cit>); cf. also elliptically: sedulo, inquam, faciam: sed fortuna fortes; <cit><quote lang="la">quare conare, quaeso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18637.4" n="B" level="2"> Of animals (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fortes ad opera boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae et fortiora animalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 10, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18637.5" n="C" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo fit, ut animosior senectus sit quam adolescentia et fortior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 22, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortibus oculis,</quote> <trans><tr>with eyes sparkling with courage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissimo et maximo animo ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissimo quodam animi impetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerrima et fortissima populi Romani libertatis recuperandae cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re publica forte factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nullum paulo fortius factum latere posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortia facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 53, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:38" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <trans><tr>service</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 36, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 31, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 23, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla poterat esse fortior contra dolorem et mortem disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerrimae ac fortissimae sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio fortis et virilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 231</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi forte, vehemens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non semper fortis oratio quaeritur, sed saepe placida, summissa, lenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 43, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placidis miscentem fortia dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fortĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n18637.6" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorously</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">astringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberare virgis uvas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublatis fortius manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortius attrahere lora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 708</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissime urgentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 9, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigorem fortissime servat ulmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 40, 77, § 210</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18637.7" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrepidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valiantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bravely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manfully</hi> (very freq. in all periods and kinds of composition): <cit><quote lang="la">quae (vincla, verbera, etc.) tulisse illum fortiter et patienter ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiter et sapienter ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiter excellenterque gesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere quippiam (with animose),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repudiare aliquid (with constanter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum gerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 39, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinere impetum hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absumptis rebus maternis atque paternis,</quote> <trans><tr>manfully made away with</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evellere spinas animo an agro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et melius secat res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dolabella injuriam facere fortissime perseverat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restitit hosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fortiter: <entryFree id="n18638" type="main" key="forti^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fortis <sense id="n18638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fortitudo: <entryFree id="n18639" type="main" key="forti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fortis</etym>, <sense id="n18639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strength.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18639.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically (very rare). </sense><sense id="n18639.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cb n="FORT" /> haec feminalia de bysso retorta ob fortitudinem solent contexi, <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durability</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">galeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Al. 2:25" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Al. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18639.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Bodily strength</hi> in men and animals: <cit><quote lang="la">hircorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (opp. imbecillitas), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 67</bibl>. —Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n18639.4" n="II" level="1"> Mentally, <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manliness</hi> shown in enduring or undertaking hardship; <hi rend="ital">fortitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bravery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrepidity</hi> (cf. virtus): <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudo est considerata periculorum susceptio et laborum perpessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudo est, inquit (Chrysippus), scientia rerum perferendarum vel affectio animi in patiendo ac perferendo summae legi parens sine timore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:24:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 24, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudo est animi affectio, cum in adeundo periculo et in labore ac dolore patiens, tum procul ab omni metu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (fortitudo) est dolorum laborumque contemptio ... Fortitudinem quoque aliquo modo expediunt, cum tradunt rationem neglegendae mortis, perpetiendi doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudo est rerum magnarum appetitio et rerum humilium contemptio et laboris cum utilitatis ratione perpessio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 25, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">probe definitur a Stoicis fortitudo, cum eam virtutem esse dicunt propugnantem pro aequitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:62 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 62 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudinis animi et fortitudinis est, nihil extimescere, omnia humana despicere, nihil quod homini accidere possit intolerandum putare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde in laboribus et periculis fortitudo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae sunt solae virtutes imperatoriae, labor in negotiis, fortitudo in periculis, industria in agendo, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sentire prudentiae est: facere fortitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 40, 86</bibl></cit>: pro multitudine hominum et pro gloria belli atque fortitudinis, angustos se fines habere arbitrabantur (Helvetii), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudinem Gallorum Germanorumque miramur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malarum rerum audacia fortitudo vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 11</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: sunt igitur domesticae fortitudines non inferiores militaribus, <hi rend="ital">proofs of valor</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">valiant decds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fortiusculus: <entryFree id="n18640" type="hapax" key="forti^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n18640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [fortis.; cf. forticulus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat strong</hi> or <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, Sutrius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fortuito: <entryFree id="n18641" type="main" key="fortu^i_^to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortŭī^tō</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">fortŭī^tū</orth>, <sense id="n18641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. fortuitus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fortuitus: <entryFree id="n18642" type="main" key="fortu^i_^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortŭī^tus</orth> (i long, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Sept. Sap. de Solon. 3</bibl>; short, Petr. Poët. Sat. 135; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:225" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 225</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 182</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>forte; analog. with gratuitus</etym>, <sense id="n18642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that takes place by chance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">casual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accidental</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortuitous</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">concursio rerum fortuitarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:19:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 19, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concursus atomorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursu quodam fortuito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cespes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contubernium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subita et fortuita oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesensiones non fortuitae (shortly before: non id fortuito accidisse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:53:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 53, 109</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7</bibl></cit>. 13: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse inordinatum atque fortuitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 46</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam illa fortuita aderant omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § 11; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 1, 5: fortuitorum laus brevior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam capax fortuitorum quam mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 48</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fortŭī^to</orth> (post-class. access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">fortŭī^tu</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:35:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 35, 22</bibl>. Also found in some MSS. and edd. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 41</bibl>; cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl>; Hand, Turs. II. 743; but Ellendt defends it, ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:24:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 24, 111</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">by chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accidentally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortuitously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">casually</hi> (very freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: casu, forte, temere): ut mihi ne in deum quidem cadere videatur, ut sciat, quid casu et fortuito futurum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim temere nec fortuito sati et creati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temere ac fortuito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:55:186" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 55, 186</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">reversing the order: partitio non est fortuito nec temere facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fortuito sed consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fortuito aut sine consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: donata consulto, non fortuito nata, Cic. <pb n="773" /> <cb n="FORT" /> Leg. 1, 8, 25: <cit><quote lang="la">immoderate et fortuito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive major aliqua causa atque divinior hanc vim ingenuit: sive hoc ita fit fortuito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod verbum tibi non excidit fortuito: scriptum, meditatum, cogitatum attulisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuito in sermonem incidisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 24, 111</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuito aliquid concluse apteque dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 53, 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fortuna: <entryFree id="n18643" type="main" key="fortu_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortūna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (archaic <sense id="n18643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> fortunas, like familias, escas, vias, etc., Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679</bibl> P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lengthened from fors; cf. Nep-tunus, v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 434</etym>, <hi rend="ital">chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortune</hi> (good or ill; syn.: casus, fors; fatum, providentia). </sense><sense id="n18643.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est enim aliud fors, quid fortuna, quid casus, quid eventus, nisi cum sic aliquid cecidit, sic evenit, ut vel non cadere atque evenire, vel aliter cadere atque evenire potuerit? quo modo ergo id, quod temere fit caeco casu et volubilitate fortunae, praesentiri et praedici potest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec habent aliquam talem necessitatem: quid est tandem quod casu fieri aut forte fortuna putemus? Nihil enim est tam contrarium rationi et constantiae quam fortuna: ut mihi ne in deum quidem cadere videatur, ut sciat, quid casu et fortuito futurum sit. Si enim scit, certe illud eveniet: sin certe eveniet, nulla fortuna est: est autem fortuna: rerum igitur fortuitarum nulla praesensio est, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec fortuna viderit, quoniam ratio non gubernat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir ad casum fortunamque felix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tot sunt in corpore bona, tot extra corpus in casu atque fortuna ... plus fortunam quam consilium valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(bona) posita non tam in consiliis nostris quam in fortunae temeritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversante fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum ego causa timidius me fortunae committebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae rotam pertimescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: secundam fortunam pulcherrime: adversam aeque ferre, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prospera adversave fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 37, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliatam fortunam conferre cum florente fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integra fortuna (opp. afflicta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentissima (opp. durior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non praecipua, sed par cum ceteris fortunae condicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae fortuna fatalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 36, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se suas civitatisque fortunas ejus fidei permissurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. II. B. 1. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> infra.).—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna miserrima tuta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna meliores sequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 48, 15</bibl></cit> (Dietsch): fortuna cum blanditur, captatum venit, Publ. Syr. 167 (Rib.): fortes fortuna adjuvat; v. fortis, II. A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n18643.2" n="B" level="2"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fortuna</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luck</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fortune: He.</hi> Respice me. <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Fortuna quod nec facit nec faciet me jubes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequiquam tibi Fortuna faculam lucrifica adlucere volt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo in genere vel maxime est Fortuna numeranda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:24:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 24, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu, Fortuna, quis est crudelior in nos te deus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeviat atque novos moveat Fortuna tumultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortunae fanum antiquum (Syracusis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortunae in gremio sedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:85 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 41, 85 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona Fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Malam Fortunam in aedis te adduxi meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala Fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 25, 63</bibl>: Fors Fortuna; <cit><quote lang="la">v. fors: Fortunae filius,</quote> <trans><tr>child of fortune</tr>, <tr>fortune's favorite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 49</bibl></cit>; v. filius.</sense><sense id="n18643.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18643.4" n="A" level="2"> Without secunda or adversa, either <hi rend="ital">good luck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ill luck</hi>, according to the context. </sense><sense id="n18643.5" n="1" level="3"> For fortuna secunda, <hi rend="ital">good luck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum est, ut de felicitate pauca dicamus ... Maximo, Marcello, Scipioni ... non solum propter virtutem, sed etiam propter fortunam saepius imperia mandata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium hoc omnium mortalium est, fortunam a deo petendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturna cum fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 20, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbum se praebuit in fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum ipsa fortuna caeca est, sed eos etiam plerumque efficit caecos, quos complexa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fortuna deseri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 34, 2</bibl></cit>: fortunam habere, <cb n="FORT" /> <hi rend="ital">to succeed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam sibi facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 40, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habendam fortunae gratiam, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 73, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum fortuna fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos precetur et oret, Ut redeat miseris, abeat fortuna superbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tu fortunam, sic nos te feremus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venimus ad summum fortunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te Confestim liquidus fortunae rivus inauret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidit Spes omnis et fortuna nostri Nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 4, 71</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: Fortunam citius reperias quam retineas, Publ. Syr. 168 (Rib.).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n18643.6" n="b" level="4"> Per fortunas, i. e. <hi rend="ital">for heaven's sake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 20, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18643.7" n="2" level="3"> For fortuna adversa, <hi rend="ital">ill luck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mishap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adversity</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae renascens alite lugubri Fortuna tristi clade iterabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut arte Emendaturus fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18643.8" n="B" level="2"> = condicio, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lot</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">a favorite expression of Cicero): est autem infima condicio et fortuna servorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 13, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in infimi generis hominum condicione atque fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 34, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Lampsaceni) populi Romani condicione socii, fortuna servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:32:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 32, § 81</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so corresp. to condicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aedui queruntur fortunae commutationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non modo omnium generum, aetatum, ordinum omnes viri ac mulieres, omnis fortunae ac loci, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines infimā fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferiorem esse fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes amplificandae fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui cessit triplicis fortuna novissima regni,</quote> <trans><tr>lot</tr>, <tr>share</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arruns Camillam Circuit et quae sit fortuna facillima temptat,</quote> <trans><tr>opportunity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 761</bibl></cit>: Gallus utrum avem, an gentem, an fortunam corporis significet, <hi rend="ital">bodily condition</hi> (of a eunuch), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si eo meae fortunae redeunt, abs te ut distrahar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes laudare fortunas meas, qui gnatum haberem tali ingenio praeditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus laudare fortunas, quod qua vellet ingredi posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et secundas fortunas amittere coactus est, et in adversis sine ullo remedio permanere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 7, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18643.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <orth extent="full" lang="la">fortunae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, less freq. in the <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possessions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortune.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18643.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum propter rei publicae calamitates omnium possessiones erant incertae: nunc deum immortalium benignitate omnium fortunae sunt certae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona fortunaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:44:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 44, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia fortunaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunas morte dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et honore et auctoritate et fortunis facile civitatis suae princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunis sociorum consumptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunarum pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:122" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18643.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo mihi fortuna, si non conceditur uti?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mea concessa est aliis fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adiri nomen invidiosae fortunae Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:60:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 60, 1</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">de fortuna, qua uterque abundabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam in nominibus habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:7:40" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 7, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fortunarius: <entryFree id="n18644" type="main" key="fortu_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortūnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fortuna</etym>, <sense id="n18644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resulting from fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brought about by chance; n.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in haec et hujuscemodi fortunaria dispositis equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 1:44" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 1, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fortunate: <entryFree id="n18645" type="main" key="fortu_na_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortūnātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fortuno, <sense id="n18645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
