fortunatim: <entryFree id="n18646" type="hapax" key="fortu_na_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortūnātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>fortunatus</etym>, <sense id="n18646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">luckily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunately</hi>: fortunatim, feliciter ac bene vortat, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 112, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 112 ed. Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
fortunatus: <entryFree id="n18647" type="main" key="fortu_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortūnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from fortuno.</entryFree>
fortuno: <entryFree id="n18648" type="main" key="fortu_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fortūno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic form of the <sense id="n18648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> fortunassint, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 109, 18</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fortuna, II. A. 1.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make prosperous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make happy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prosper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bless</hi>: prosperare, omnibus bonis augere, Non. l. l. (class.; most freq. in the <pos>P. a.</pos>); constr. usually (alicui) aliquid: <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Di fortunabunt vostra consilia! <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Ita volo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 175</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi patrimonium dei fortunent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eumque honorem tibi deos fortunare volo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod faxitis, deos velim fortunare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 41, 12</bibl></cit>: quamcumque deus tibi fortunaverit horam, <hi rend="ital">whatever happy hour Providence has allotted you</hi>, Hor. Ep. <cb n="FORU" /> 1, 11, 22.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: deos ego omnes, ut fortunassint, precor, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fortūnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">prospered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi> (syn.: beatus, felix). </sense><sense id="n18648.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">salvus atque fortunatus semper sies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et miser sum et fortunatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me in terra aeque Fortunatus erit, si illa ad me bitet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam est hic fortunatus putandus, cui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam insipiente fortunato intolerabilius fieri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudat senem et fortunatum esse dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:24:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi vero Cn. et P. Scipiones comitatu nobilium juvenum fortunati videbantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o hominem fortunatum!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 25, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunate senex!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunatus et ille deos qui novit agrestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">c fortunatam rem publicam!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: o fortunatam natam me consule Romam, id. poët Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:24" default="NO">11, 1, 24</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunatus illius exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:329" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 96, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nobis haec habitatio Bona, fausta, felix fortunataque eveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit> (v. felix).—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquis me hodie vivit fortunatior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carneades dicere solitus est, nusquam se fortunatiorem quam Praeneste vidisse Fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 295</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archelaüs, qui tum fortunatissimus haberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunatissimo proelio decertare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:12:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18648.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunatus laborum,</quote> <trans><tr>happy in his sufferings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunate animi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:638" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 638</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18648.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18648.4" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to fortuna, II. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">In good circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wealthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia fortunati et potentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Scopam, fortunatum hominem et nobilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid vos hanc miseram ac tenuem sectamini praedam, quibus licet jam esse fortunatissimis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 35, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18648.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fortūnātae Insŭlae</orth>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tw=n *maka/rwn nih=soi</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the fabulous isles of the Western Ocean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the abodes of the blessed;</hi> acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">the Canary Isles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 36, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:202" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 32, 37, § 202</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Fortunatorum insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 148</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf.: amoena virecta fortunatorum nemorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 639</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fortūnāte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fortunately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc bene vivo et fortunate atque ut volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile et fortunate evenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feliciter, absolute, fortunate vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scite aut fortunate gestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
foruli: <entryFree id="n18649" type="main" key="fo^ru^li1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>forus</etym>. <sense id="n18649.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A book-case</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros Sibyllinos condidit duobus forulis auratis sub Palatini Apollinis basi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:219" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 219</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18649.1" n="II" level="1"> Fori significant et Circensia spectacula, ex quibus etiam minores forulos dicimus, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. forum, p. 84 Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18650" type="main" key="Fo^ru^li2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fŏrŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient city of the Sabines</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cività Tommasa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 11, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 714</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:417" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 417</bibl>.—Hence, FORVLANVS, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Foruli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Forulan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3794</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
forum: <entryFree id="n18651" type="main" key="fo^rum" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, (archaic form <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, to accord with locus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 55</bibl> P., and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 206, 15</bibl>; Pompon. ib.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. root Sanscr. dhar-, support; dhar-as, mountain, etc.; Lat. forma, fortis, frenum, etc.; lit., a place or space with set bounds, Corss. Ausspr. 1, 149</etym>, <sense id="n18651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">what is out of doors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an outside space</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place;</hi> in partic., as opp. the house, <hi rend="ital">a public place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a market-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">market</hi> (cf.: macellum, emporium, velabrum): forum sex modis intelligitur. Primo, negotiationis locus, ut forum Flaminium, forum Julium, ab eorum nominibus, qui ea fora constituenda curarunt, quod etiam locis privatis et in viis et in agris fieri solet. Alio, in quo judicia fieri, cum populo agi, contiones haberi solent. Tertio, cum is, qui provinciae praeest, forum agere dicitur, cum civitates vocat et de controversiis eorum cognoscit. Quarto, cum id forum antiqui appellabant, quod nunc vestibulum sepulcri dicari solet. Quinto, locus in navi, sed tum masculini generis est et plurale (v. forus). Sexto, fori significant et Circensia spectacula, ex quibus etiam minores forulos dicimus. Inde et forare, foras dare, et fores, foras et foriculae, id est ostiola dicuntur,<pb n="774" /> <cb n="FORU" />  Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=84" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 84</bibl> Müll. </sense><sense id="n18651.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an open space.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18651.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The area before a tomb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fore-court</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (lex XII. Tabularum de sepulcris) FORUM, id est, vestibulum sepulcri, BUSTUMVE USUCAPI vetat, tuetur jus sepulcrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18651.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The part of the wine-press in which the grapes were laid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:71" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:3" default="NO">12, 18, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18651.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: fora = fori, <hi rend="ital">the gangways</hi> of a ship, Gell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 55</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n18651.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a public place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">market-place.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18651.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A market</hi>, as a place for buying and selling: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vendere vellent quo conferrent, forum appellarunt. Ubi quid generatim (i. e. secundum singula genera), additum ab eo cognomen, ut forum boarium, forum olitorium, cupedinis, etc. ... Haec omnia posteaquam contracta in unum locum quae ad victum pertinebant et aedificatus locus: appellatum macellum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=145 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 145 sq.</bibl></cit> Müll.— Esp. </sense><sense id="n18651.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">forum boarium</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the cattlemarket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Circus Maximus and the Tiber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=146" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 146</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=30:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 30, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 62, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 5, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 24</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 477</bibl>. A part of this was probably the <orth extent="full" lang="la">forum suarium</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:12:1:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 12, 1, § 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18651.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">forum olitorium</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the vegetable-market</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south of the theatre of Marcellus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Tiber and the Capitoline hill</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">here stood the columna lactaria, at which infants were exposed,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=146" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 146</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 63, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 49</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=118:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 118, 6</bibl>. Here was probably the <orth extent="full" lang="la">forum coqui-num</orth> <itype>also</itype>, <hi rend="ital">in which professional cooks offered their services in preparing special entertainments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18651.9" n="(g)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">fo-rum piscarium</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">piscatorium</orth>), <hi rend="ital">the fish-market</hi>, between the basilica Porcia and the Temple of Vesta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=146" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 146</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51:5" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 51, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18651.10" n="(d)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">forum cuppedinis</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the market for dainties</hi>, between the via sacra and the macellum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=186" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 186</bibl> Müll. Cf. the similar market in another town, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 30</bibl> (dub. Hildebr. cupidinis).—Of places where markets were held, <hi rend="ital">a market-town</hi>, <hi rend="ital">market-place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Clodius, pharmacopola circumforaneus, qui properaret, cui fora multa restarent, simul atque introductus est, rem confecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum Numidarum, nomine Vaga, forum rerum venalium totius regni maxime celebratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 47, 1</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: Scisti uti foro, <hi rend="ital">you knew how to make your market</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">how to act for your advantage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 29</bibl>; v. Don. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n18651.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The market-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forum</hi>, in each city, as the principal place of meeting, where public affairs were discussed, courts of justice held, money transactions carried on: <cit><quote lang="la">statua ejus (Anicii) Praeneste in foro statuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19, 18</bibl></cit>; hence also, transf., to denote <hi rend="ital">affairs of state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administration of justice</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">banking business.</hi> In Rome esp. the forum Romanum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 24</bibl>; called also forum magnum, vetus, or, oftener, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, forum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:16" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 40, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 14</bibl> et saep.; <hi rend="ital">a low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open artificial level</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about six hundred and thirty Parisian feet long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and rather more than a hundred wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Capitoline and Palatine hills</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounded by porticos</hi> (basilicae) <hi rend="ital">and the shops of money-changers</hi> (argentariae), <hi rend="ital">in later times surrounded with fine buildings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and adorned with numberless statues</hi> (cf. on it Becker's Antiq. 1, p. 281 sq., and Dict. of Antiq. p. 451): <cit><quote lang="la">in foro infumo boni homines atque dites ambulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro turbaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arripere verba de foro,</quote> <trans><tr>to pick them up in the street</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vulgus et in foro dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 30</bibl></cit> (Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 262, 24</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum Decimus quidam Verginius virginem filiam in foro sua manu interemisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in forum descendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2</bibl></cit> (Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 501, 28</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">foro nimium distare Carinas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallacem Circum vespertinumque pererro Saepe forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forumque litibus orbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hostes in foro ac locis patentioribus cuneatim constiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores ad forum producti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut primum forum attigerim,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>engaged in public affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 39</bibl></cit>: forum putealque Libonis Mandabo siccis, <cb n="FORU" /> adimam cantare severis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the grave affairs of state</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 8</bibl>.—Of administering justice in the forum: NI PAGVNT, IN COMITIO AVT IN FORO ANTE MERIDIEM CAVSAM CONICITO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pacem cum bello, leges cum vi, forum et juris dictionem cum ferro et armis conferatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (tempus) in judiciis ac foro datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ferrea jura Insanumque forum aut populi tabularia vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold a court</tr>, <tr>hold an assize</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenta fori pugnamus harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. vv. sqq.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">indicitque forum et patribus dat jura vocatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 758</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates, quae in id forum convenerant,</quote> <trans><tr>to that court - district</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra suum forum vadimonium promittere,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond his district</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">38.—Prov.: egomet video rem vorti in meo foro,</quote> <trans><tr>is pending in my own court</tr>, <tr>affects me nearly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alieno foro litigare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not to know what to do</tr>, <tr>which way to turn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12 praef" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12 praef.</bibl></cit>—Of the transaction of business in the forum: <cit><quote lang="la">haec fides atque haec ratio pecuniarum, quae Romae, quae in foro versatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quousque negotiabere? annos jam triginta in foro versaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublata erat de foro fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi, etc. ... nos hunc Postumum jam pridem in foro non haberemus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he would have been a bankrupt long ago</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 15, 41</bibl></cit>: cedere foro, <hi rend="ital">to quit the market</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to become bankrupt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:39" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:7:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 7, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 50</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 16</bibl>. Justice was administered in Rome not only in the forum Romanum, but also, in the times of the emperors, in the forum (Julii) Caesaris (erected by Julius Caesar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:236" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 44, 86, § 236</bibl>) and in the forum Augusti (erected by the Emperor Augustus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>, and adorned with a fine ivory statue of Apollo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:552" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 552</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 27</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">called simply forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 128</bibl></cit> (where Apollo is called juris peritus, in allusion to the judicial proceedings held here); hence, circumscriptiones, furta, fraudes, quibus trina non sufficiunt fora, Sen. de Ira, 2, 9, 1; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quae (verba) trino juvenis foro tonabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:15" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 15</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">erit in triplici par mihi nemo foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:38:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuo clausoque sonant fora sola theatro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:68" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 68</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18651.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Nom. propr.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fŏrum</orth>, <itype>a name of many market and assize towns, nine of which, in Etruria, are named</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 116</bibl>. The most celebrated are, </sense><sense id="n18651.13" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Forum Ăliēni</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Transpadana, now <hi rend="ital">Ferrara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18651.14" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Forum Appii</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a market-town in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the</hi> Via Appia, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> Tres Tavernae, now <hi rend="ital">Foro Appio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 780 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n18651.15" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Forum Aurēlium</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a small city near Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the</hi> Via Aurelia, now <hi rend="ital">Montalto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18651.16" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Forum Cornē-lium</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Cispadana, now <hi rend="ital">Imola</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Foro-corneliensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18651.17" n="5" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Forum Gallōrum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Cispadana, <hi rend="ital">between</hi> Mutina <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Bononia, now <hi rend="ital">Castel Franco</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 30, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18651.18" n="6" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Forum Jūlii</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">a colony of the eighth legion</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Frejus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 35</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 43</bibl>.—Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Forojulien-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Forum Julii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Forojulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Forum Julii</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 43</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Forojulien-ses</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Forum Julii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Forojulians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18651.19" n="7" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Forum Vŏcōnii</orth>, 24 <hi rend="ital">miles from Forum Julii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Pyrenees</hi>, now, acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">Le Canet;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">Luc</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
forus: <entryFree id="n18652" type="main" key="fo^rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>) [kindred with forum, foras, foris, from fero; what leads out of doors; hence], <sense id="n18652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gangway</hi> in a ship. </sense><sense id="n18652.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: multa foro ponit et agea longa repletur, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 2</bibl>: illum nautis forum, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 206, 17</bibl>: cum alii malos scandant, alii per foros cursent, <cb n="FOSS" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Charon), laxat foros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 412</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> form: fora, Cn. Gell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 55</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n18652.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18652.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A row of seats</hi> in the Circus: <cit><quote lang="la">loca divisa patribus equitibusque, ubi spectacula sibi quisque facerent: fori appellati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foros in Circo faciendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 56, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 1, 7</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. forum, p. 84 Müll. (v. the passage under forum <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>— * </sense><sense id="n18652.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A passage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alley</hi> or <hi rend="ital">walk around a bed</hi> in a garden: <cit><quote lang="la">angustosque foros adverso limite ducens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:92" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 92</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18652.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cell</hi> of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">complebuntque foros et floribus horrea texent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 250</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18652.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A gaming-board</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dice-board</hi>: forum aleatorium calfecimus, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18653" type="main" key="fo^rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏrus</orth>, <itype>i, for forum</itype>, v. 1. forum <sense id="n18653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fosi: <entryFree id="n18654" type="main" key="Fosi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fosi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Germanic tribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a branch of the Cheruscans</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Celle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fossa: <entryFree id="n18655" type="main" key="fossa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fossa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fodio, i. e. fossa terra</etym>, <sense id="n18655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ditch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fosse</hi> (syn.: fovea, scrobs, fossio). </sense><sense id="n18655.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18655.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">salso suffudit gurgite fossas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fodere fossam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unus aditus maximo aggere objecto fossa cingeretur vastissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oppidum) vallo et fossa circumdedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomarium circummunire fossă praecipiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumdare moenia vallo atque fossā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, in a different construction: circumdare fossam latam cubiculari lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallo fossaque munire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Rheni fossam immanissimis gentibus objicere et opponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossa et vallo aliquem septum tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossam pedum XX. directis lateribus duxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fossam ducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 73, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversam fossam obducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutae fossae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 46, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut flumen nullam in partem depressis fossis derivari posset,</quote> <trans><tr>sunk deeper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:40:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprimere fossam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 8:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:821" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 821</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor in fossam confusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18655.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18655.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A gutter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waterway</hi>, = colliciae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 326</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 372</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18655.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A furrow</hi> drawn to mark foundations, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse humili designat moenia fossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:839" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 839</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:32:section=143" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 32, § 143</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18655.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A grave</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">FILETIVS VSQVE AT FOTSA (ad fossam),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4794</bibl></cit>, v. fossor.—</sense><sense id="n18655.7" n="4" level="3"> In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">pudenda muliebria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Socraticos notissima fossa cinaedos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18655.8" n="5" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fos-sa Drūsiāna</orth>, v. Drusus.—*</sense><sense id="n18655.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a boundary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui fossam determinare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fossatum: <entryFree id="n18656" type="main" key="fossa_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fossātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">fossātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. fosso.</entryFree>
fossicius: <entryFree id="n18657" type="main" key="fossi_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fossīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fossus, from fodio</etym>, <sense id="n18657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dug out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dug up</hi> from the ground: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 54, § 175</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 10</bibl>. Cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
fossilis: <entryFree id="n18658" type="main" key="fossi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fossĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dug out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dug up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fossil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:11:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 2, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 66, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 18, 29, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fossio: <entryFree id="n18659" type="main" key="fossi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fossĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fodio</etym>, <sense id="n18659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digging</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">recenti fossione terram fumare calentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:41" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 39, § 247</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fossiones agri repastinationesque proferam?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18659.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a ditch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fossitius: <entryFree id="n18660" type="main" key="fossi_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fossītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. fossicius.</entryFree>
fosso: <entryFree id="n18661" type="main" key="fosso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fosso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>fodio</etym>, <sense id="n18661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce</hi> (ante-and post-class.): corpora telis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=100" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 100</bibl> (Ann. v. 569 ed. Vahl.).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n18661.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">fossātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a ditch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fosse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18661.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">fossātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a boundary</hi>, Auct. Rei Agr. p. 254 and 267 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
fossor: <entryFree id="n18662" type="main" key="fossor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fossor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ditcher.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18662.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18662.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">et labefacta movens robustus jugera fossor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalidus in magna compede fossor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:71:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 71, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:38" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu septa novus jam moenia laxet Fossor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a miner</tr>, <tr>sapper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:419" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 419</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18662.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18662.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A miner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">workman in a mine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:118" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 118</bibl> (cf. aurifossor).—</sense><sense id="n18662.5" n="2" level="3"><pb n="775" /> <cb n="FOVE" />  In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">a grave-digger</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4925 al.</bibl>; cf. fossa, I. B. 3.—</sense><sense id="n18662.6" n="3" level="3"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">a fornicator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 49</bibl>; cf. fossa, I. B. 4.—</sense><sense id="n18662.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., in a contemptuous signif., <hi rend="ital">a common laborer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a clown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 22, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sis cetera fossor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:122" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fossorius: <entryFree id="n18663" type="main" key="fosso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fossōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>fodio</etym>, <sense id="n18663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adapted to digging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit for delving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars (securis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 19, 11</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fossōria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">digging</hi> (as an occupation), Firm. Math. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fossula: <entryFree id="n18664" type="main" key="fossu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fossŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fossa</etym>, <sense id="n18664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little ditch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 161, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:54" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:46:3" default="NO">12, 46, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fossura: <entryFree id="n18665" type="main" key="fossu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fossūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fodio</etym>, <sense id="n18665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digging</hi> (postAug., whereas fossio is quite class.). </sense><sense id="n18665.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">plana fossura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:14:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 10, 14, 2</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">complanata juga fossuris montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puteorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:28:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 28, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18665.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a pit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa fossura operiatur arundinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fossus: <entryFree id="n18666" type="main" key="fossus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fossus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from fodio.</entryFree>
fostia: <entryFree id="n18667" type="gloss" key="fostia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fostia</orth>, v. hostia <sense id="n18667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fostis: <entryFree id="n18668" type="gloss" key="fostis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fostis</orth>, v. hostis <sense id="n18668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fotus: <entryFree id="n18669" type="main" key="fo_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from foveo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18670" type="main" key="fo_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fōtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>foveo</etym>, <sense id="n18670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a warming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fomenting</hi> (post-Aug., rare except in <case>abl.</case>). </sense><sense id="n18670.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decoctum eorum coeliacos juvat et potione et fotu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 10, § 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:164" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 9, 82, § 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fotus ex aqua calida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7:97" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7, 97</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 304</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18670.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: queis gloria fotibus aucta Sic cluat, Prud. cont. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:584" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 584</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fovea: <entryFree id="n18671" type="main" key="fo^ve^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏvĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindred with favissae</etym>, <sense id="n18671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small pit</hi>, esp. for taking wild beasts, <hi rend="ital">a pit fall</hi> (syn.: scrobs, specus: fossa, etc.). </sense><sense id="n18671.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18671.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(humor) ut in foveam fluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cadavera) Donec humo tegere ac foveis abscondere discunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 558</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitales feminae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the womb</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18671.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a pitfall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pit</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tetra belua, quae quoniam in foveam incidit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1250</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 459</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anates in foveas delapsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 38, 54, § 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18671.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a snare</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">ita decipiemus fovea leonem Lycum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 45</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex iisdem foveis emergentes,</quote> <trans><tr>conspiracy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 9, 1</bibl></cit>,</sense></entryFree>
fovela: <entryFree id="n18672" type="main" key="fo^ve_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏvēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>foveo</etym>, <sense id="n18672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comforting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refreshment</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">incorporalitas est immunis a poena et a fovela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
foveo: <entryFree id="n18673" type="main" key="fo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>fōvi, fōtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Corss. assumes a root bhag-, to be hot; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fw/gein</foreign>, to roast; O. H. Germ. bachan; Germ. backen; Engl. bake; hence, fovere for fog-vēre; favilla for fag-villa; and to this refers: favere, faustus, etc., Ausspr. 1, 142; 2, 1004; but cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 188" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 188</bibl>, and v. faveo</etym>, <sense id="n18673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep warm</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the transf. and trop. signif.; syn.: calefacio: faveo, studeo, adjuvo, etc.). </sense><sense id="n18673.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi sol sua pro parte fovet tribuitque calorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:807" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 807</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1033" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1033</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut et pennis (pullos) foveant, ne frigore laedantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 129</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulli a matribus exclusi fotique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus rigentes apprimendo pectori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laridum atque epulas foveri foculis ferventibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos sancta fovet ille manu, bene vivitis ignes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>keeps up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:427" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 427</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, in a different construction: fovet ignibus aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen in marmore lectum Perfudit lacrimis et aperto pectore fovit,</quote> <trans><tr>warmed the name with her naked breast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:339" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 339</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18673.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cherish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foster</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n18673.3" n="A" level="2"> Physically. So of diseased parts of the body, <hi rend="ital">to foment</hi> (whether with warm or cold remedies): <cit><quote lang="la">dumque manet corpus, corpus refoventque foventque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares exulceratas fovere oportet vapore aquae calidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa aqua prius calida, post egelida fovendum os caputque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua calido aceto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervos cortice et foliis in vino decoctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 37, § 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:106" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 34, § 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem lacte asinino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os quoque multa frigida aqua fovendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem frigida et ante et postea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus lymphă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 420</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen. (a favorite word with Vergil): interdum gremio fovet inscia Dido (puerum),<cb n="FRAC" />  <hi rend="ital">cherishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holds in her lap</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 718</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">germanam sinu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctantem lacertis amplexu molli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to embrace</tr>, <tr>enfold</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animas et olentia Medi ora fovent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse aeger, anhelans Colla fovet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>leans against the tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:838" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 838</bibl></cit>: castra fovere, <hi rend="ital">to remain in the camp</hi> (the figure being that of a bird brooding over its nest), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(coluber) fovit humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 420</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf. to a period of time: nunc hiemem inter se luxu, quam longa, fovere, Regnorum immemores,</quote> <trans><tr>sit the winter through</tr>, <tr>pass the winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 193</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18673.4" n="B" level="2"> Mentally, <hi rend="ital">to cherish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribis de Caesaris summo in nos amore. Hunc et tu fovebis et nos quibuscumque poterimus rebus augebimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicum meum sic fovebant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vettienum, ut scribis, et Faberium foveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et eo puto per Pomponium fovendum tibi esse Hortensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(duo duces) pugnantes hortabantur et prope certa fovebant spe,</quote> <trans><tr>encouraged</tr>, <tr>animated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni plebis in cooptandis collegis patrum voluntatem foverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 65, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 36, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 36, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem potentioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex statuerat utram foveret partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 29, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectator populus hos, rursus illos clamore et plausu fovebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu mihi gubernacula rei publicae petas fovendis hominum sensibus et deleniendis animis et adhibendis voluptatibus?</quote> <trans><tr>by pampering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adolescentiam alicujus exhortationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut propria naturae bona doctrina foverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia et artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis in pectore meo foveo, quas meus filius turbas turbet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dwell upon</tr>, <tr>think over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:49:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 49, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequiquam eos perditam spem fovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 53, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6 praef.</bibl> § 9; cf. conversely: ut spes vos foveat, <hi rend="ital">may sustain you</hi>, Just. Inst. prooem. 7: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc regnum dea gentibus esse, jam tum tenditque fovetque,</quote> <trans><tr>cherishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: dum illud tractabam, de quo antea scripsi ad te, quasi fovebam dolores meos (the fig. being taken from the fomenting of diseased parts of the body; <cit><quote lang="la">v. above, II. A.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantomimos fovebat effusius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fovii: <entryFree id="n18674" type="gloss" key="Fovii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fovii</orth> <itype>qui nunc Favii dicuntur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n18674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fracebunt: <entryFree id="n18675" type="gloss" key="fracebunt"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fracebunt</orth> <itype>displicebunt</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=90" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 90</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n18675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">FRACEBUNT sordebunt, displicebunt, dictum a fracibus, qui sunt stillicidia sterquilinii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> p. 463</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fraces: <entryFree id="n18676" type="main" key="fra^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frăces</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (sing. form FRAX; <sense id="n18676.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with FRAG, frango; cf. fragosus; lit., broken bits, fragments; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">grounds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dregs of oil</hi>: FRAX <foreign lang="greek">trugi/a ga/rou</foreign>; fraces <foreign lang="greek">e)lai/ou trugi/a: u(po/stasis e)lai/ou</foreign>; fracere <foreign lang="greek">e)ci/stasqai</foreign>; fracidus <foreign lang="greek">u(pe/rwros</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum quam diutissime in amurca et in fracibus erit, tam deterrimum erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">66</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:13:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:21 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 21 sq.</bibl> al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 474</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fracesco: <entryFree id="n18677" type="main" key="fra^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frăcesco</orth>, <itype>fracŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n18677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [FRACEO; v. fraces and FRACEBUNT], <hi rend="ital">to become soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olea lecta si nimium diu fuit in acervis, caldore fracescit, et oleum foetidum fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 55:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 55, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes rancid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: (terram cretosam) sinito quatriduum fracescat; <cit><quote lang="la">ubi bene fracuerit, rutro concidito,</quote> <trans><tr>to become soft</tr>, <tr>tractable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fracidus: <entryFree id="n18678" type="hapax" key="fra^ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frăcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>FRACEO; whence fracesco and fraces</etym>, <sense id="n18678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mellow</hi>: ut fracida sit (olea), cato, R. R. 64, 1.</sense></entryFree>
fractaria: <entryFree id="n18679" type="hapax" key="fracta_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fractārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. machina) [frango], <sense id="n18679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a machine for crushing flint-stones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedunt (silices) fractariis CL libras ferri habentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 71</bibl></cit>; v. Sillig. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
fractio: <entryFree id="n18680" type="main" key="fracti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breaking in pieces</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Cons. Evang. 4:25" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Cons. Evang. 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:24:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 24, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fractor: <entryFree id="n18681" type="main" key="fractor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fractor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breaker in pieces</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ferularum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>. <cb n="FRAG" /></sense></entryFree>
fractura: <entryFree id="n18682" type="main" key="fractu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fractūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>frango</etym>, <sense id="n18682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fracture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad luxum aut ad fracturam alliga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo propior fractura capiti (ossis) vel superiori vel inferiori est, eo pejor est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:126" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 11, 47, § 126</bibl> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 71</bibl>, the correct read. is fractariis; v. fractaria).</sense></entryFree>
fractus: <entryFree id="n18683" type="main" key="fractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from frango.</entryFree>
fraeno: <entryFree id="n18684" type="main" key="fraeno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraeno</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fraenum</orth>, etc., v. fren-.</entryFree>
fraga: <entryFree id="n18685" type="main" key="fra_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frāga</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root Sanscr. dhraj-, breathe; prop., the fragrant berry; hence, Fr. fraise</etym>, <sense id="n18685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strawberries</hi>: Fragaria vesca, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 28, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 516" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 516</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n18685.1" n="II" level="1"> In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fragum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a strawberry-plant</hi>, also called comaron, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fragesco: <entryFree id="n18686" type="main" key="fra^gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frăgesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n18686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [FRAG, frango], <hi rend="ital">to become broken;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to be conquered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdued</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 111, 1 sq.</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 26, 338 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
fragilis: <entryFree id="n18687" type="main" key="fra^gi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frăgĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily broken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brittle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragile</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the transf. signif.; cf.: caducus, fluxus). </sense><sense id="n18687.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coryli (with tiliae molles),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">phaselus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes malleis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 20, § 94</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saccharon dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 8, 17, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crystalli centrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 2, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput ictibus parvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuior fragiliorque penna scarabaeorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fragilis glacies interit ira mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 347</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragiles sonitus chartarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>crackling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollicibus fragiles increpuere manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 12;
