cf. fragor.—</sense><sense id="n18687.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perishable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frail</hi> (physically or mentally): <cit><quote lang="la">fragile corpus animus sempiternus movet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in fragili corpore odiosa omnis offensio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(corpora) fragili natura praedita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 581</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragili quaerens illidere dentem, Offendet solido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: fragilissimus alvus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 193, 26</bibl>.—Of an effeminate man: Julius et fragilis Pediatia (sarcastically in the <hi rend="ital">fem. gen.</hi> instead of Pediatius), qs. <hi rend="ital">the delicate Miss Pediatius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim confidit, sibi semper id stabile et firmum permansurum, quod fragile et caducum sit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res humanae fragiles caducaeque sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiarum et formae gloria fluxa atque fragilis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliud est aeque fragile in homine (quam memoria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 24, 24, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli vita fragilior (quam homini),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit> § 5; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(hominum) aevum omne et breve et fragile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:78:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 78, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud aevi fragilis sonipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:386" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 386</bibl></cit>: anni fragiles et inertior aetas, <hi rend="ital">the frail years</hi> (of age), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
fragilitas: <entryFree id="n18688" type="main" key="fra^gi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frăgĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fragilis</etym>, <sense id="n18688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brittleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragility.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18688.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tus probatur candore, amplitudine, fragilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuiora ferramenta oleo restingui mos est, ne aqua in fragilitatem durentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 146</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18688.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to fragilis, II.), <hi rend="ital">weakness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frailness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frailty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humani generis imbecillitatem fragilitatemque extimescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae communis, Auct. Or. pro Marcello, 7, 22: fidei humanae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fragium: <entryFree id="n18689" type="hapax" key="fra^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frăgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>FRAG, frango</etym>, <sense id="n18689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fracture</hi> of a part of the body (for fractura): <cit><quote lang="la">crurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 225, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fraglo: <entryFree id="n18690" type="main" key="fraglo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraglo</orth>, v. fragro <sense id="n18690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fragmen: <entryFree id="n18691" type="main" key="fragmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fragmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>FRAG, frango</etym>. * <sense id="n18691.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fracture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussit subito deceptum fragmine pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:477" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 477</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18691.1" n="II" level="1"> Mostly in <number>plur.</number>: fragmina, um, <hi rend="ital">pieces broken off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wreck</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose for the class. fragmenta). </sense><sense id="n18691.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 284</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1284" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1284</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucronis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 741</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 561</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:563" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjacebant fragmina telorum equorumque artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subselliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <trans><tr>crumbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favorum, quae in sacco remanserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Absol.</hi> of <hi rend="ital">bits of wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chips</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedas et fragmina poni Imperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8</bibl></cit>, <pb n="776" /> <cb n="FRAG" /> 459.—</sense><sense id="n18691.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilioneus saxo atque ingenti fragmine montis Lucetium sternit,</quote> <trans><tr>fragment of a mountain</tr>, <tr>piece of rock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 569</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 698</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 9, 53 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fragmentum: <entryFree id="n18692" type="main" key="fragmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fragmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>FRAG, frango</etym>, <sense id="n18692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piece broken off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a piece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remnant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragment</hi> (class.; mostly in <number>plur.</number>; cf.: frustum, segmentum). </sense><sense id="n18692.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inermem atque imparatum tribunum alii gladiis adoriuntur, alii fragmentis septorum et fustibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 37, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:39:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 39, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 24, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which ramea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avulsarum tabularum remorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crystalli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 10, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <trans><tr>crumbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Emathiae ruinae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the remains of the army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18692.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragmentum lapidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:32:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 32, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fragor: <entryFree id="n18693" type="main" key="fra^gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frăgor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breaking to pieces.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18693.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pausam stare fragori,</quote> <trans><tr>to fragility</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 747</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:317" default="NO" valid="yes">317</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18693.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a crashing</hi> (as when something is broken to pieces), <hi rend="ital">a crash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">din</hi> (the usual signif. of the word; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus, sonor): ut crebram silvam cum flamina Cauri Perflant, dant sonitum frondes ramique fragorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sternitur nemus, et propulsa fragorem silva dat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragor tectorum, quae diruebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruentium tectorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti procella dat fragorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multus geli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 154</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitoque fragore intonuit laevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 692</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 541</bibl>; cf. 8, 527; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Periclea) fulminibus et caelesti fragori comparant comici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus praecipitans se fragore auditum accolis aufert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimitas profecto et magnificentia et nitor et auctoritas expressit illum fragorem,</quote> <trans><tr>those thunders of applause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exornatio significandae rei causa, sic: Postquam iste in rem publicam fecit impetum, fragor civitatis imprimis est auditus. Hoc genere raro utendum est, ne novi verbi assiduitas odium pariat, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 31, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra continens adventus hostium non modo exspectatos, sed etiam repentinos multis indiciis et quasi fragore quodam et sonitu ipso ante denuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3</bibl></cit> Mos.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:753" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 753</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fragose: <entryFree id="n18694" type="main" key="fra^go_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frăgōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fragosus <sense id="n18694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fragosus: <entryFree id="n18695" type="main" key="fra^go_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frăgōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fragor</etym>. <sense id="n18695.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to fragor, I.) <hi rend="ital">Apt to be broken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragile</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n18695.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragosa putri corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:860" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 860</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18695.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uneven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvis horrentia saxa fragosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 778</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 527</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18695.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">uneven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unequal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragosa atque interrupta oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures fragosis offenduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 499</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n18695.4" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to fragor, II.) <hi rend="ital">Crashing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rushing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roaring</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">medioque fragosus Dat sonitum saxis et torto vertice torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:622" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx Maleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:261" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 261</bibl></cit>: lux, <hi rend="ital">a rattling gleam</hi> (lightning), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 198</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmura leonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> II. Cons. Stil. 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fră-gōse</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">with a crashing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(secures a ligno laricis) respuuntur et fragosius sidunt, aegrius revelluntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fragrans: <entryFree id="n18696" type="main" key="fra_grans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frāgrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. fragro.</entryFree>
fragranter: <entryFree id="n18697" type="main" key="fra_granter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frāgranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fragro, <sense id="n18697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fragrantia: <entryFree id="n18698" type="main" key="fra_granti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frāgrantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fragro</etym>, <sense id="n18698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragrance</hi> (post-class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">odor, nidor, suffimen): unguentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 27</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 6, § 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fragro: <entryFree id="n18699" type="main" key="fra_gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frāgro</orth> (collat. form fraglo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> Carm. 10, 287</bibl>), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. dhraj-, breathe, etc.; hence frāga; cf. flare, to blow</etym>, <sense id="n18699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to emit a smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smell</hi> (of both good and bad odors), <hi rend="ital">to emit fragrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reek</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; esp. freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n18699.1" n="I" level="1"> Of a pleasant odor. </sense><sense id="n18699.2" n="(a)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod semper casiaque cinnamoque Fragras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:55:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragravit ore, quod rosarium Paesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et multa fragrat testa senibus auctumnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 58, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma vinum fragrat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18699.3" n="(b)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redolentque thymo fragrantia mella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4</bibl></cit>, <cb n="FRAN" /> 169; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> A 1, 436</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubile sertis ac Syrio olivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus Assyrio odore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 68, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adolescentulus unguento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus balsama,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amomum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:117" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18699.4" n="II" level="1"> Of an unpleasant smell: <cit><quote lang="la">fragrat acerbus odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:493" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne gravis hesterno fragres, Fescennia, vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:88:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 88, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">frāgrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">sweet - scented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragrant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragrantissimum unguentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 249, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragrantissimus spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 85</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">frāgranter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fragrantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crocum Ciliciae spirat fragrantius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 38, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fragum: <entryFree id="n18700" type="main" key="fra_gum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frāgum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. fraga.</entryFree>
framea: <entryFree id="n18701" type="foreign" key="fra^me^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frămĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>an old Germ. word</etym>. <sense id="n18701.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A spear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">javelin</hi>, used by the ancient Germans: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas vel ipsorum vocabulo frameas gerunt angusto et brevi ferro, sed ita acri et ad usum habili, ut eodem telo, proüt ratio poscit, vel comminus vel eminus pugnent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>; 18; 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18701.1" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">a sword</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 120:16" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 120, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 16, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
franci: <entryFree id="n18702" type="main" key="Franci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Franci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Franks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Germanic confederacy on the Rhine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Laud. Stil. 189</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">227</bibl>; II. Laud. Stil. 243; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Procul. 13 al.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number> collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">ante pedes humili Franco tristique Suevo Perfruor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutrop. 1, 394</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18702.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n18702.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Francia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the region inhabited by the Franks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Franconia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 434</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 237</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18702.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Francus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Franks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Frank</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Vit. Hilar. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18702.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Francĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of the emperor Probus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of his victories over the Franks</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
francicus: <entryFree id="n18703" type="main" key="Franci^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Francĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, Venant. 9, Carm. 48.</entryFree>
frango: <entryFree id="n18704" type="main" key="frango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frango</orth>, <itype>frēgi, fractum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root in Gr. FPAT, <foreign lang="greek">r(h/gnumi, r(h=gma, r(wgale/os</foreign>; Goth. Brikkan; Irish brissim; Germ. brechen; Engl. break; but cf. Fick, Vergl. Wörterb. p. 182, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">F</ref></xr></etym>, <sense id="n18704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dash to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break in two</hi> (cf.: rumpo, diffringo). </sense><sense id="n18704.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: hastas frangit quatitque, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 435 ed. Vahl.); cf.: aes sonit, franguntur hastae, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 504, 33</bibl> (Trag. v. 213 ed. Vahl.): fraxinus frangitur atque abies consternitur alta, <hi rend="ital">is broken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">felled</hi>, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 195 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milvo est quoddam bellum quasi naturale cum corvo: ergo alter alterius ubicumque nactus est ova, frangit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus aureus fractus et comminatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:25:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 25, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compluribus navibus fractis,</quote> <trans><tr>dashed to pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem is fregit apud Andrum insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 44, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus fracta conjectu lapidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janua frangatur, latret canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lagenam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crystallina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:111" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulas in caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora ad saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 625</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindices rerum capitalium laqueo gulam fregere,</quote> <trans><tr>broke his neck</tr>, <tr>strangled him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervices civium Romanorum in carcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:57:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 57, § 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senile guttur parentis impiā manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerebrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brachium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 253</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">coxam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 19, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu in arbore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:121" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego te, tigris ut aspera Gaetulusve leo, frangere persequor,</quote> <trans><tr>to tear in pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">indomitos ut cum Massyla per arva Armenti reges magno leo fregit hiatu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:28" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:458" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 458</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes in montem actae non franguntur, sed circumfunduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:28:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 28, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18704.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to break up small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bruise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crush</hi> (freq. since the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">glebam bidentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 400</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">glebas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges robore saxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:882" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 882</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">farra saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:448" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum molis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 14, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">granum dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 24, 54, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glandem (sues),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes homini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 49, 110, § 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toros,</quote> <trans><tr>to press</tr>, <tr>throw one's self upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:59:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 59, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:8:6" default="NO">4, 8, 6</bibl>: comam in gradus, <hi rend="ital">to twist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">braid</hi>, <cb n="FRAN" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare montis ad ejus Radices frangit fluctus,</quote> <trans><tr>breaks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 695</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (fortunam) existimo levem et imbecillam ab animo firmo et gravi tamquam fluctum a saxo frangi oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus (scopulus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:282" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem nando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 374</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:457" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 457</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:555" default="NO">8, 555</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>turn off from it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:232" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 232</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18704.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate; to soften</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Viriathum) C. Laelius praetor ita fregit et comminuit ferocitatemque ejus ita repressit, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>broke down</tr>, <tr>subdued</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fractam illam et debilitatam vim suam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem series immensa laborum fregerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes frangere domareque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proeliis calamitatibusque fracti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victi sumus igitur, aut, si vinci dignitas non potest, fracti certe et abjecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ut ulla res frangat?</quote> <trans><tr>would break</tr>, <tr>shake thy resolution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frangi metu, cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fractus ac debilitatus metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flecti animo atque frangi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frangi animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit> et simil.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: aliquem auctoritate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem patientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:25:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: quae (vis) summas frangit infirmatque opes, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">debilitatur ac frangitur eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis illa educatio, quam indulgentiam vocamus, nervos omnes et mentis et corporis frangit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frangitur vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox Auditur fractos sonitus imitata tubarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et illa (littera), quae est sexta nostrarum (i. e. F) quoties aliquam consonantem frangit, ut in hoc ipso frangit, multo fit horridior,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>weakens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 29</bibl></cit> Spald. (v. the passage in its connection); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum divisit ineleganter: duo enim genera quae erant, fecit tria: hoc est non dividere, sed frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frangas citius quam corrigas, quae in pravum induruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum proeliis frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (pedum dolorem) abstinentiā, sanctitate vicit et fregit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut equorum cursum delicati minutis passibus frangunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:113" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos frangi et debilitari molestiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium (mala),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:14:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimia pectora (Venus et vinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:301" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego unus contudi et fregi exsultantis praedonis audaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 301, 8</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 36</bibl> ed. Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">furorem et petulantiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pis. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium iramque (risus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum cogitationis (membranae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:chapter=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura pudicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 28: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morantem diem mero (= breviorem reddere),</quote> <trans><tr>to shorten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to weaken</tr>, <tr>dilute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:103" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum frangerem jam ipse me cogeremque illa ferre toleranter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec animus tantis se laboribus frangeret, neque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante quam calores aut frigora se fregerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>diminished</tr>, <tr>abated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Scaevola paulum quiescet, dum se calor frangat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fracti aestus et nondum orta frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus se frangit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 392" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glacies se frangit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">weakened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque adeo fracta est aetas effetaque tellus Vix animalia parva creat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me audis fractiorem esse animo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>more disheartened</tr>, <tr>less courageous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spes amplificandae fortunae fractior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in compositione fractus,</quote> <trans><tr>powerless</tr>, <tr>feeble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est tam fractum, tam minutum, tam in ipsa concinnitate puerile?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">corruptum et omnibus vitiis fractum dicendi genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 125</bibl></cit>: corrupta oratio maxime comprehensione obscura, compositione fracta consistit, id. <pb n="777" /> <cb n="FRAT" /> 8, 3, 57: <cit><quote lang="la">effeminata et fracta impudicis modis (musice),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frater: <entryFree id="n18705" type="main" key="fra_ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frāter</orth>, <itype>tris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. bhrātā; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fra/thr, fra/twr</foreign>, clansman; Goth. brothar; Engl. brother</etym>, <sense id="n18705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brother.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18705.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater mi, salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mi frater, mi frater, mi frater, tune id veritus es? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amabo te, mi frater, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. frater meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxores habent inter se communes: et maxime fratres cum fratribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem a fratre renuntiatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et filius et fratris filius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratris filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres gemini,</quote> <trans><tr>twin-brothers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres gemelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 77</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also in the reverse order: gemini fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 670</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 250</bibl> (and therefore wrongly censured by Quint.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam ordine permutato fiunt supervacua, ut fratres gemini: nam si praecesserint gemini, fratres addere non est necesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 24</bibl></cit>).— Also in <hi rend="ital">sing.: To.</hi> Hic ejus geminus est frater. <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Hiccine'st? <hi rend="ital">To.</hi> Ac geminissimus. <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Di deaeque et te et geminum fratrem excrucient, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:49 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 49 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venimus fratrem quaesitum geminum germanum meum,</quote> <trans><tr>my full twin-brother</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spes mihi est, vos inventuros fratres germanos duos Geminos, una matre natos et patre uno uno die,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Phaenius ... frater germanus Q. Titinii,</quote> <trans><tr>full brother</tr>, <tr>own brother</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:49:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 49, § 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 17, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres uterini,</quote> <trans><tr>brothers by the same mother</tr>, <tr>uterine brothers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 62, 21</bibl></cit>: fratribus illa (templa) deis fratres de gente deorum Circa Juturnae composuere lacus, <hi rend="ital">the brothers of a race of gods</hi> (Tiberius and Drusus), <hi rend="ital">descended from the divine brothers</hi> (Castor and Pollux), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:707" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 707</bibl>.—Of the giants: <cit><quote lang="la">fratresque tendentes opaco Pelion imposuisse Olympo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurati fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 280</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of dogs: <cit><quote lang="la">et Thous et Cyprio velox cum fratre Lycisca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 220</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 299</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n18705.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18705.3" n="A" level="2"> Like our word <hi rend="ital">brother</hi>, as a familiar appellation of friends and lovers. </sense><sense id="n18705.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam copiose laudatur Apronius a Timarchide ... Volo, mi frater, fraterculo tuo credas: consorti quidem in lucris atque in furtis, gemino et simillimo nequitia, improbitate, audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:66:section=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 66, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater, pater, adde: Ut cuique est aetas, ita quemque facetus adopta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater erat Romae consulti rhetor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eheu cicatricum et sceleris pudet Fratrumque,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of dear fellow-citizens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 35, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:135" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 135</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 31, 5</bibl>.—So freq. of civil wars: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudent perfusi sanguine fratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudeles gaudent in tristi funere fratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18705.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18705.6" n="a" level="4"> Of lovers: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi intercederent mihi inimicitiae cum istius mulieris viro: fratre volui dicere: semper hic erro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 13, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:65:14" default="NO">10, 65, 14</bibl> (cf. soror); <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 9, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18705.7" n="b" level="4"> In publicists' lang., an honorary title given to allies: <cit><quote lang="la">Aedui, fratres consanguineique saepenumero a senatu appellati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo hostes, sed etiam fratres nostri Aedui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aedui fratres nostri pugnant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. fraternitas). —</sense><sense id="n18705.8" n="B" level="2"> Fratres for <hi rend="ital">brother and sister</hi> (as also the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)delfoi/</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">Lucius et Titia fratres emancipati a patre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres fratres, Titius, Naevius et Seia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:35" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrum incestus, amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">INFANTIBVS HILARIONI ET REVOCATAE FRATRIBVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4583</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18705.9" n="C" level="2"> Like Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)delfo/s</foreign>, of near kindred. </sense><sense id="n18705.10" n="1" level="3"> Frater patruelis, <hi rend="ital">a cousin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a father's brother's son</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic illius frater patruelis et socer T. Torquatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Cicero frater noster, cognatione patruelis, amore germanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1, § 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which simply frater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:24:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 24, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Post Red. in Sen. 10, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18705.11" n="2" level="3"> Perh. also for levir (cf. the Fr. <hi rend="ital">beaufrère</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a brother-in-law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister's husband</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope attonitus ipso congressu Numida, gratias de fratris filio remisso agit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 35, 8</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 19, 9</bibl>).— </sense><sense id="n18705.12" n="D" level="2"> Fratres Arvales, <hi rend="ital">a college of priests;</hi> v. arvalis.—</sense><sense id="n18705.13" n="E" level="2"> Frater Solis et Lunae, <hi rend="ital">the title of the Parthian kings</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>, <cb n="FRAT" /> 5.—</sense><sense id="n18705.14" n="F" level="1"> Of things of a like kind (so, too, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a\delfo/s</foreign>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also soror): aspicies illic positos ex ordine fratres (i. e. libros),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:107" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 107</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 3, 6</bibl>.—As a proper name: <cit><quote lang="la">(In Mauretania) montes sunt alti, qui ... ob numerum Septem, ob similitudinem Fratres nuncupantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 25</bibl> (in Ptolemy, <foreign lang="greek">*(epta\ a)delfoi/</foreign>; cf. Mann. Afr. 2, p. 459).</sense></entryFree>
fraterculo: <entryFree id="n18706" type="hapax" key="fra_tercu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frātercŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>fraterculus</etym>, a word comically formed by Plautus, after the analogy of sororiare, and also used of the breasts, <sense id="n18706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swell up alike</hi> (v. sororio), Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=297" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 297</bibl> Müll.; cf. also FRATRARE.</sense></entryFree>
fraterculus: <entryFree id="n18707" type="main" key="fra_tercu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frātercŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>frater</etym>, <sense id="n18707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little brother.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18707.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: unde fit, ut malim fraterculus esse Gigantis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of unknown parents.</hi> qs. <hi rend="ital">sprung from the earth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 98</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18707.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to frater, II. A.), a familiar appellation given to a friend: <cit><quote lang="la">quam copiose laudatur Apronius a Timarchide ... Volo, mi frater, fraterculo tuo credas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:66:section=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 66, § 155</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fraterne: <entryFree id="n18708" type="main" key="fra_terne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frāterne</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fraternus <sense id="n18708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fraternitas: <entryFree id="n18709" type="main" key="fra_terni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frāternĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fraternus</etym>, <sense id="n18709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brotherhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraternity</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fraternitatis vinculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aedui soli Gallorum fraternitatis nomen cum populo Romano usurpant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 16:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 16, 2</bibl> (cf. frater, Il. A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, and fraternus, Il.).</sense></entryFree>
fraternus: <entryFree id="n18710" type="main" key="fra_ternus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frāternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frater</etym>, <sense id="n18710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brotherly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraternal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18710.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese et amore fraterno et existimatione vulgi commoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tametsi in ipso fraterno parricidio nullum scelus praetermissum videtur, tamen, etc. ... ab hereditate fraterna excludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: acerba fata Romanos agunt, Scelusque fraternae necis, <hi rend="ital">of fratricide</hi> (committed by Romulus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 18</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fraterno primi maduerunt sanguine muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 95</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra (because given to Apollo by his brother Mercury),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 21, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <trans><tr>of Zethus</tr>, <tr>brother of Amphion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 43</bibl></cit>: undae, <hi rend="ital">of Neptune</hi> (as brother of Jupiter), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 367</bibl>: invidia, <hi rend="ital">against his brother</hi> (shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">fratris invidia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18710.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18710.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a relalive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kinsman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater erat, fraterna peto,</quote> <trans><tr>the arms of his cousin Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:163" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 1:178" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 178</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18710.4" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to frater, II. A.) <hi rend="ital">Brotherly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraternal</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">closely allied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter amorem in nos fraternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro fraterna illa necessitudine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18710.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of animals yoked together: <cit><quote lang="la">it tristis arator Maerentem abjungens fraterna morte juvencum,</quote> <trans><tr>of his companion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 518</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">frāterne</orth>. </sense><sense id="n18710.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In a brotherly manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare facis tu quidem fraterne, quod me hortaris, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18710.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Heartily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affectionately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi persuadeas, te a me fraterne amari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fratilli: <entryFree id="n18711" type="gloss" key="fratilli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fratilli</orth> <itype>villi sordidi in tapetis</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=90" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 90</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
fratrare: <entryFree id="n18712" type="gloss" key="fra_tra_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frātrāre</orth> (al. ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">frātriāre</orth>) <itype>puerorum mammae dicuntur, cum primum tumescunt</itype>, quod velut fratres pares oriuntur: quod etiam in frumento spica facere dicuntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=91" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 91</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <sense id="n18712.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">‡ fratrarent, turgerent, pubescerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> p. 463</bibl></cit> (cf. fraterculo).</sense></entryFree>
fratria: <entryFree id="n18713" type="gloss" key="fra_tria1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frātria</orth>, <itype>uxor fratris</itype> (<sense id="n18713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sister-inlaw</hi>), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=90" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 90</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fratriae appellantur fratrum inter se uxores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 557, 9</bibl></cit>; and: fratria, <foreign lang="greek">ei)na/thr</foreign>, Gloss. Philox; also called ‡ fratrissa, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 7, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18714" type="gloss" key="fratria2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fratria</orth> <itype>est Graecum vocabulum partis hominum, ut Neapoli etiam nunc</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=85" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 85</bibl> Müll. (= <foreign lang="greek">fratri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n18714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a division of the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">answering to the</hi> Lat. curia, <hi rend="ital">the third part of a</hi> <foreign lang="greek">fulh/</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
fratricida: <entryFree id="n18715" type="main" key="fra_tri^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frātrĭcīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>frater-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n18715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who murders a brother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fratricide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 1</bibl>; Cic. pro Domo, 10, 26.</sense></entryFree>
fratricidium: <entryFree id="n18716" type="main" key="fra_tri^ci_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frātrĭcīdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fratricida</etym>, <sense id="n18716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the murder of a brother. fratricide</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 14</bibl>; Salv. de Gub. Dei, 1, p. 25.</sense></entryFree>
fratrissa: <entryFree id="n18717" type="gloss" key="fra_trissa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frātrissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. ‡ fratria.</entryFree>
fratruelis: <entryFree id="n18718" type="main" key="fra_tru^e_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frātrŭēlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>frater, analog. with patruelis</etym>, <sense id="n18718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a father's brother's son</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cousin</hi> <cb n="FRAU" /> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrueles filii materterae sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fraudabilis: <entryFree id="n18719" type="main" key="frauda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fraudo</etym>, <sense id="n18719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deceiving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraudulent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fraudatio: <entryFree id="n18720" type="main" key="frauda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cheating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceiving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defrauding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraud</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac parte pudor pugnat, illinc petulantia: hinc fides, illinc fraudatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: VT INTER BONOS BENE AGIER OPORTET ET SINE FRAVDATIONE, an old legal formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 70</bibl>: QVI FRAVDATIONIS CAVSA LATITARIT, Edict. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 19, 60</bibl>: QVAE FRAVDATIONIS CAVSA GESTA ERVNT, etc., Edict. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:8:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ad eri fraudationem callidum ingenium gerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fraudator: <entryFree id="n18721" type="main" key="frauda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defrauder</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">creditorum Trebellius et homo diruptus dirutusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudatorum et infitiatorum impudentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fraudatorius: <entryFree id="n18722" type="main" key="frauda_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to cheating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fraud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:96" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:67" default="NO">36, 1, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fraudatrix: <entryFree id="n18723" type="main" key="frauda_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fraudator</etym>, <sense id="n18723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who cheats</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defrauds</hi> (eccl. Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. servatrix),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fraudifer: <entryFree id="n18724" type="main" key="fraudi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fraus + fero</etym>, <sense id="n18724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fraudulent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Carm. de Genes. 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fraudiger: <entryFree id="n18725" type="main" key="fraudi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fraus + gero</etym>, <sense id="n18725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cheating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraudulent</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">loquelae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Genes. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fraudo: <entryFree id="n18726" type="main" key="fraudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudo</orth> (arch. <orth extent="full" lang="la">frūdo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n18726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudassis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; in the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">fraussus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: frausus erit, fraudem commiserit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=91" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 91</bibl> Müll.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fraus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beguile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defraud</hi> one of any thing (class.; syn.: fallo, frustror, circumvenio; inesco, deludo, decipio, etc.). </sense><sense id="n18726.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Aliquem aliqua re: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Caecilius a Vario magnā pecuniā fraudaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">grano uno fraudare decumanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:8:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 8, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites praedā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites stipendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurigarios mercede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos minutis mutuationibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos equidem non fraudaverim debitā laude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes suā gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legentes judicio maximi auctoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros somno (Aurora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amantem spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superos ture,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:20:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 20, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus seniles animā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animus) mutila sentit quaedam et quasi decurtata: quibus, tamquam debito fraudetur, offenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:53:178" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 53, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fraudare suo veteri nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 91</bibl></cit> (v.
