Madvig ad h. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba aliqua sui parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina origine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarum factum memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:92" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudans se ipse victu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:10" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 47, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18726.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Simply aliquem: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ille unciatim vix de demenso suo, suum defraudans genium, compersit miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis sit, qui socium fraudarit et fefellerit, consideremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: VTI NE PROPTER TE FIDEMVE TVAM CAPTVS FRAVDATVSVE SIEM, an old legal formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quempiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in hereditaria societate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 24, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernas (sc. oleo),</quote> <trans><tr>to deprive of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipso jure rescindi quod fraudandae legis gratia esset ascriptum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to violate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:64" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18726.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With a homogeneous object: <cit><quote lang="la">metuo in commune, ne quam fraudem frausus siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18726.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to embezzle</hi> a thing from a person, <hi rend="ital">to purloin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steal; to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to diminish</hi> (perh. not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">hi stipendium equitum fraudabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 59, 3</bibl></cit>: cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: fraudata restituere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 60</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonam publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:12:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Papin.</author> ib. 39, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego frudavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 58</bibl>, where the correct read. is defraudassis): <cit><quote lang="la">bellum adversus Turnum propter fraudatas Laviniae nuptias fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>withdrawn</tr>, <tr>not granted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic gignitur laudatus ille pallor, saturitate fraudatā,</quote> <trans><tr>diminished</tr>, <tr>weakened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 39, 64, § 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fraudulenter: <entryFree id="n18727" type="main" key="fraudu^lenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudŭlenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fraudulentus <sense id="n18727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <pb n="778" /> <cb n="FRAU" /></sense></entryFree>
fraudulentia: <entryFree id="n18728" type="main" key="fraudu^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudŭlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deceitfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disposition to defraud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentientium, Hilar. ap. Matt. 4, 23: simulatae mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Trin. 1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 2</bibl>, §§ 13, 16; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 13, 9</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 7</bibl>, the correct read. is, fraudulenta; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 34</bibl>, the whole verse is spurious; v. Ritschl and Lorenz ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
fraudulentus: <entryFree id="n18729" type="main" key="fraudu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fraus</etym>, <sense id="n18729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cheating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraudulent</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ecquem recalvom ac silonem senem (vidistis), fraudulentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginienses fraudulenti et mendaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 26, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venditiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 21, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calliditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:18:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus (with humilis and servilis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 83</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto fraudulentior deus vester, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 28</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex bonis pessimi et fraudulentissimi fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magice fraudulentissima artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudŭlenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">deceitfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraudulently</hi>: fraudulenter atque avariter, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 510, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudeliter aut fraudulenter infestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 35</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum animal fraudulentius invidere homini tradunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fraudulosus: <entryFree id="n18730" type="main" key="fraudu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraudŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraudulent</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">contrectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fraus: <entryFree id="n18731" type="main" key="fraus1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraus</orth>, <itype>fraudis</itype> (<sense id="n18731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> fraudium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:18:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 18, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 19, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:23:section=4 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 23, § 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 214</bibl>; archaic form <hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi> frudi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 187</bibl> Lachm.; cf. <case>acc.</case> frudem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 187</bibl>; acc. to Cod. Quadrat.; <hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> frudes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:B. Pun. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> B. Pun. 1, 1</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. root dhru-, bend, injure; Sanscr. dhru-ti, deception; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">titrw/skw</foreign>, wound, <foreign lang="greek">qrau/w</foreign>, break, and Lat. frustum, frustra, Corss. Ausspr. 1, 150; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 222" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 222</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a cheating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraud</hi> (class. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; syn.: dolus, fallacia, calliditas, etc.). </sense><sense id="n18731.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum duobus modis, id est aut vi aut fraude fiat injuria, fraus quasi vulpeculae, vis leonis videtur: utrumque homini alienissimum, sed fraus odio digna majore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne ab imis unguibus usque ad verticem summum ex fraude, fallaciis, mendaciis constare totus videtur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraus fidem in parvis sibi praestruit, ut, cum operae pretium sit, cum mercede magna fallat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes sine fide tempus atque occasionem fraudis ac doli quaerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraude ac dolo aggressus est (urbem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per summam fraudem et malitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fraudem obsequio impelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuo in commune, ne quam fraudem frausus siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudis, sceleris, parricidii, perjurii plenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Litavici fraude perspecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi fraudem facere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to circumvent</tr>, <tr>evade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: contra legem facit, qui id facit, quod lex prohibet; <cit><quote lang="la">in fraudem vero legis, qui salvis verbis legis sententiam ejus circumvenit. Fraus enim legi fit, ubi, quod fieri noluit, fieri autem non vetuit, id fit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit> and 30: <cit><quote lang="la">quod emancipando filium fraudem legi fecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facio fraudem senatusconsulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventum deverticulum est in fraude earum (legum), gallinaceos quoque pascendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 50, 71, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid in fraudem creditorum factum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:8:6:section=8 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 8, 6, § 8 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese dedere sine fraude constituunt,</quote> <trans><tr>without deception</tr>, <tr>honorably</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine fraude Punicum emittere praesidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 47, 8</bibl></cit> (in another sense under II. C. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">audax Iapeti genus (Prometheus) Ignem fraude malā gentibus intulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter enim ad sororis filios quam concordiae fraude pervenire non poterat,</quote> <trans><tr>by the deceitful pretence of unanimity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae cibum ad fraudem suam positum aspernuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">exagitabantur omnes ejus fraudes atque fallaciae,</quote> <trans><tr>deceptions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fons est fraudium, maleficiorum, scelerum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:18:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 18, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem peccatis et fraudibus objice nubem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Europe) scatentem Beluis pontum mediasque fraudes Palluit audax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18731.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18731.3" n="A" level="2"> Concr., of persons as <cb n="FREG" /> a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">a cheater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cheat</hi> (ante-class and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fur, fugitive, fraus populi, Fraudulente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerro, iners, fraus, heluo, ganeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18731.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a bad action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crime</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">otio aptus in fraudem incidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim periculum, ne aut neglectis iis (rebus divinis) impia fraude, aut susceptis anili superstitione obligemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si C. Rabirius fraudem capitalem admisit, quod arma contra L. Saturninum tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus frausque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscepta fraus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocituram postmodo te natis fraudem committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 31</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">re publica violanda fraudes inexpiabiles concipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 72</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18731.5" n="C" level="2"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">a being deceived</hi>, <hi rend="ital">selfdeception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">error</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistake</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">is me in hanc illexit fraudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperitos in fraudem illicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; cf.: oculi, supercilia, frons, vultus denique totus ... hic in fraudem homines impulit; <cit><quote lang="la">hic eos, quibus erat ignotus, decepit, fefellit, induxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in fraudem induimus frustraminis ipsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemquam pellicere in fraudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1005" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1005</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacere in fraudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1206</bibl></cit>: in fraudem deducere, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fraudem incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in fraudem in re publica delabi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:60:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 60, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tibi dent in eo flammarum corpora fraudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tibi sit frudi, quod nos inferne videmus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Euryalum) jam manus omnis Fraude loci et noctis ... oppressum rapit,</quote> <trans><tr>deception as to</tr>, <tr>ignorance of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 397</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18731.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detriment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damage.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18731.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Prop., produced by deception or ignorance: aliud fraus est, aliud poena; <cit><quote lang="la">fraus enim sine poena esse potest, poena sine fraude esse non potest. Poena est noxae vindicta, fraus et ipsa noxa dicitur et quasi poenae quaedam praeparatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:131" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18731.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harm</hi>, in gen. (in the best prose confined to the phrases, sine fraude and fraudi esse; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">tuis nunc cruribus scapulisque fraudem capitalem hinc creas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id mihi fraudem tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse alicui fraudi aut crimini,</quote> <trans><tr>to tend to his injury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res nemini umquam fraudi fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 33, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 12, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 11, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 17, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latum ad populum est, ne C. Servilio fraudi esset, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19, 9 al.</bibl></cit>: sine fraude, or archaic SE (SED) FRAVDE, <hi rend="ital">without injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without damage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without risk</hi> (= sine damno, sine noxa): SI PLVS MINVSVE SECVERVNT SE FRAVDE ESTO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:49" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 49</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. sine: rex respondit: QVOD SINE FRAVDE MEA POPVLIQVE ROMANI QVIRITIVM FIAT, FACIO,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterae multitudini diem statuit, ante quam sine fraude liceret ab armis discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis deus in fraudem, quae dura potentia nostra Egit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam nosces, ventosa ferat cui gloria fraudem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 708</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18732" type="main" key="Fraus2" n="III"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fraus</orth>, <itype>personified</itype>, <sense id="n18732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 44</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">In the service of Mercury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the god of thieves</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fraussus: <entryFree id="n18733" type="main" key="fraussus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. fraudo <sense id="n18733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
frax: <entryFree id="n18734" type="gloss" key="frax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frax</orth>, v. fraces <sense id="n18734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fraxare: <entryFree id="n18735" type="gloss" key="fraxa_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraxāre</orth>, <itype>vigiliam circuire</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=91" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 91</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
fraxineus: <entryFree id="n18736" type="main" key="fraxi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraxĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. fraxinus</etym>, <sense id="n18736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of ash-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ashen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 369</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fraxinus: <entryFree id="n18737" type="main" key="fraxi^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraxĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ash-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ash</hi>, remarkable for its slenderness: Fraxinus excelsior, Linn. </sense><sense id="n18737.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 13, 24, § 62</bibl> et saep.; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 195 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">fraxinus in silvis pulcherrima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 359</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:677 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 677 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n18737.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an ashen spear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">javelin</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fraxinea hasta, v. the prec. art.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">324</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:102" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18738" type="hapax" key="fraxi^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fraxĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. fraxinus</etym>, <sense id="n18738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of ash-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ashen</hi> (usually fraxineus): <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fregellae: <entryFree id="n18739" type="main" key="Fre^gellae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Frĕgellae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very old city of the Volsci</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Liris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made a Roman colony</hi> B. C. 328, now <hi rend="ital">Ceperano</hi>, Liv. <cb n="FREM" /> 8, 22; 9, 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 27, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:477" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 477</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:529 al" default="NO">12, 529 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n18739.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A quarter of Rome inhabited by Fregellans</hi>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=91" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 91</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n18739.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Frĕgellānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Fregellae</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fregellan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:76:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 76, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Papirius Fregellanus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Fregellae</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:170" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 46, 170</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Frĕgellāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Fregellae</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fregellans</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:170" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 46, 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26" default="NO" valid="yes">26</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
fregenae: <entryFree id="n18740" type="main" key="Fre^ge_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Frĕgēnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">freghni/a, h(</foreign>, <sense id="n18740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town of Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> Alsium, now <hi rend="ital">Maccarese</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
fremebundus: <entryFree id="n18741" type="main" key="fre^me^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕmĕbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fremo</etym>, <sense id="n18741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making a low roaring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snorting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">muttering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murmuring</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): tanta moles (Argo), Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illapsu (elephantorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:463" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum vero praeceps (Achilles) curru fremebundus ab alto Desilit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fremitus: <entryFree id="n18742" type="main" key="fre^mi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕmĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roaring sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rushing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murmuring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snorting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loud noise</hi> (class.; syn.: crepitus, fremor, strepitus, stridor): omne sonabat Arbustum fremitu silvaï frondosaï, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 197 ed. Vahl.); cf. imbrium, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 12</bibl> (Trag. v. 147 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad fluctum aiunt declamare solitum Demosthenem, ut fremitum assuesceret voce vincere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmurantis maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">perfurit acri Cum fremitu, saevitque minaci murmure pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 18, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul eorum qui cum impedimentis veniebant, clamor fremitusque oriebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex nocturno fremitu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fremitus egentium et motus quidam temerarius Graeculae contionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si displicuit sententia, fremitu aspernantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dein fremitus increbruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ab Carthagine fremitum castrorum Romanorum exaudimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausu fremituque virūm Consonat omne nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor plausuque volat fremituque secundo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 338</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">boat caelum fremitu virūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canentūm (with sonus and plausus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <trans><tr>neighing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 38, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 607</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hinnitusque equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 64, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(equus) fremitum patulis ubi naribus edit (corresp. to hinnitus and hinnire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1076" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1076</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <trans><tr>growling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:237" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 18, 25, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconditus vituli marini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 13, 15, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 216</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1193</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:270" default="NO" valid="yes">270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:289" default="NO" valid="yes">289</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">410: fremitus iraeque leonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:237" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:232" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes ... consuescebat contionum fremitus non expavescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fremo: <entryFree id="n18743" type="main" key="fre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n18743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cf. <foreign lang="greek">bre/mw, bro/mos, bronth/</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n18743.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a low roaring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to roar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to growl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murmur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">howl</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: frendo, strideo, strepo, crepo): (ventus ibi) Speluncas inter magnas fremit ante tumultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 581</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti immani turbine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:646" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 646</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ister tumidā aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:329" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes undaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:654" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa concita murali tormento,</quote> <trans><tr>whiz</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:922" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 922</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae laetitiā ludisque plausuque,</quote> <trans><tr>resound</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri festis ululatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irritata canum cum primum immane Molossūm Mollia ricta fremunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1064" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1064</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo ore cruento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 341</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 19, § 48</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 104</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans><tr>neighs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 496</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">599</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus ad caulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:260" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fremant omnes licet, dicam quod sentio,</quote> <trans><tr>to mutter</tr>, <tr>grumble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in basilica Julia ... omnia clamoribus fremerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes magno circum clamore fremebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctique fremebant Caelicolae assensu vario,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncti simul ore fremebant Dardanidae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 559</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 555: animisque fremens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 371</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stabat acerba fremens Aeneas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres, erecti gaudio, fremunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: rumor de tibicine Fremit in theatro, Phaedr. <pb n="779" /> <cb n="FREN" /> 5, 7, 21.—</sense><sense id="n18743.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to murmur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grumble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">after</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to complain loudly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18743.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixerat haec unoque omnes eadem ore fremebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 132</bibl></cit>: arma amens fremit; <cit><quote lang="la">arma toro tectisque requirit, Saevit amor ferri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 460</bibl></cit>: si plebs fremere imperia coepisset, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to murmur at</hi>, Cass. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18743.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam vero Arrius consulatum sibi ereptum fremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7,3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pedum expugnandum ac delendum senatus fremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorianus miles, non virtute se sed proditione victum fremebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(M. Bruti) epistolae frementes, fibulas tribunicias ex auro geri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 12, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fremor: <entryFree id="n18744" type="main" key="fre^mor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕmor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fremo</etym>, <sense id="n18744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a low roaring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rushing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murmuring</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postclass. prose for fremitus): arma sonant, fremor oritur, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=67" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 67</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">variusque per ora cucurrit Ausonidūm fremor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 297</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 32</bibl>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonum indignati fremores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 358, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frenatio: <entryFree id="n18745" type="main" key="fre_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frēnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>freno</etym>, <sense id="n18745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bridling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subduing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Cont. Jul. 5, 7, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frenator: <entryFree id="n18746" type="main" key="fre_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frēnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a curber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tamer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">controller</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n18746.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sol) ignipedum frenator equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 27</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentis frenator Sarmata conti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a hurler</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:162" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 162</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18746.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">infinitae potestatis domitor ac frenator animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:9" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frendesco: <entryFree id="n18747" type="main" key="frendesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frendesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n18747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [frendo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to gnash</hi> with the teeth: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitate doloris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frendo: <entryFree id="n18748" type="main" key="frendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frendo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">frendeo</orth>, <itype>frendui, frēsum and fressum</itype> (v. infra), 2 and <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n18748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xrem-i/zw</foreign>, to neigh, <foreign lang="greek">xro/mh</foreign>; Germ. greinen, grinsen, Fick, Vergl. Wörterb. p. 72]. </sense><sense id="n18748.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gnash</hi> the teeth (for syn. cf. fremo): <cit><quote lang="la">ego illum male formidabam, ita frendebat dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nemeaeus leo Frendens efflavit graviter extremum halitum, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22: frendens aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et graviter frendens sic fatis ora resolvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumidā frendens Mavortius irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hannibal) frendens gemensque ac vix lacrimis temperans dicitur legatorum verba audisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frenduerunt super me dentibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:34:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 34, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor frendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 693" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 693</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: nec, machaera, audes dentes frendere, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 447, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18748.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18748.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To crush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bruise</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">grind to pieces</hi> (as if gnashing the teeth): <cit><quote lang="la">porci dicuntur nefrendes ab eo, quod nondum fabam frendere possunt, id est frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: saxo fruges frendas, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 437, 21</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. Trag. v. 478</bibl>); Pac. ib. (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. Trag. v. 11</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">fresi et aqua macerati ervi sextarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fresa cicera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faba fresa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:5" default="NO">6, 3, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: faba fressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18748.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lament over with rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gnash the teeth at</hi>: frendēre noctes, misera, quas perpessa sum, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 447, 17</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. Trag. v. 10</bibl>).—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frendente Alexandro, eripi sibi victoriam e manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frendor: <entryFree id="n18749" type="main" key="frendor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frendor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>frendo</etym>, <sense id="n18749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gnashing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dentium in Gehenna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
freni: <entryFree id="n18750" type="main" key="fre_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frēni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fraeni</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. frenum <sense id="n18750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
freniger: <entryFree id="n18751" type="hapax" key="fre_ni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frēnĭger</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fraen-</orth>), <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>frenum-gero</etym>, <sense id="n18751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bridle-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bridled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ala,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the cavalry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:98" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 98</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
freno: <entryFree id="n18752" type="main" key="fre_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frēno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fraeno</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n18752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> frenarier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 191</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>frenum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish with a bridle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bridle</hi> (mostly in poets). </sense><sense id="n18752.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frenati equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:15:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 554</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora cervi capistris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla draconum (Medea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:220" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 220</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dracones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frenato delphine sedens Thetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 237</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vecta est frenato pisce Thetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:46" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 46</bibl></cit>: frenata acies, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the cavalry</hi> (opp. pedestris), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:266" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 266</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18752.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to bridle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi> (syn.: coerceo, comprimo, etc.). </sense><sense id="n18752.3" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Aeolus ventos) Imperio premit ac vinclis et carcere frenat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina ductor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:418" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 418</bibl></cit>: cum tristis hiems <cb n="FREN" /> glacie cursus frenaret aquarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum frenat brassica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tussim medicamine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18752.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bridle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frenatam tot malis linguam resolvimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:66:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 66, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eas (voluptates) sua temperantia frenavit ac domuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (Clodii) furores, quos nullis jam legibus, nullis judiciis frenare poteramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes avidas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:341" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum (scribendi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores corde,</quote> <trans><tr>to shut up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:290" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes superbas justitiā (Dido),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 523</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aemoniam (Pelias),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:22" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis temere frenari eos dicere posset, quominus de eo libere querantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 29, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frentani: <entryFree id="n18753" type="main" key="Frenta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Frentāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mixed Italian tribe of Samnites and Illyrians who settled in Samnium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Adriatic Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the south-eastern part of what is now the Abruzzo Citra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:69:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 69, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes">45</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 38</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Frentanus, as collect.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:567" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 567</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18753.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Frentānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Frentani</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frenum: <entryFree id="n18754" type="main" key="fre_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frēnum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">fraenum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and more freq. (cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, 567; and <sense id="n18754.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <number>plur.</number> heterocl. <orth extent="full" lang="la">frēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> <orth extent="full" lang="la">frēna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root dhar-; Sanscr. dhar-ā-mi, hold, support; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qra</foreign>-, in <foreign lang="greek">qrh=nus, qro/nos</foreign>; Lat. frētus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a bridle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bit</hi> (syn.: lupi, lupata). </sense><sense id="n18754.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18754.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurei freni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <case>nom.</case> freni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. under II.; <case>acc.</case> frena, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 818</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 519</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non domito frenos ore momordit equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:42" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 42</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">frenos: equus, equa, quae frenos recipere solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 8, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">moderarier hunc (equum) frenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1298</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">frenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1317</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 719</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">889</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 372</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 643</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum cogere frenos pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frenos et strata equorum Pelethronium (invenisse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 202</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n18754.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frenumque (equus) recepit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non frenum depulit ore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18754.4" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: frenum mordere, <hi rend="ital">to take the bit in one's teeth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to offer opposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resist</hi>: si frenum momorderis peream, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 23, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ut mones, frenum momordi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ib. 11, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18754.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18754.6" n="A" level="2"> Like our terms <hi rend="ital">bridle</hi> and <hi rend="ital">curb</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">means of guiding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">governing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restraint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18754.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum freni,</quote> <trans><tr>the reins of dominion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:240" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">freni sunt injecti vobis, Quirites, nullo modo perpetiendi: alligati et constricti estis amaro vinculo servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">freni domitarum gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne Lycurgi quidem disciplina tenuit illos in hominibus Graecis frenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Isocratem in acerrimo ingenio Theopompi et lenissimo Ephori dixisse traditum est, alteri se calcaria adhibere, alteri frenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 56, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mutinam illi exsultanti tamquam frenos furoris injecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">date frenos impotenti naturae et indomito animali,</quote> <trans><tr>give the reins to</tr>, <tr>allow full scope to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">frenos furentibus ira Laxat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impone felicitati tuae frenos,</quote> <trans><tr>put on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii frena tenere sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena imperii moderari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:13:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena licentiae inicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone irae frena modumque, Pone et avaritiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:88" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subiit leges et frena momordit Ille solutus amor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>submitted to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:28" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod dicebat Isocrates, se calcaribus in Ephoro, contra autem in Theopompo frenis uti solere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 11</bibl>; cf. above the passage <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:204" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 56, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter, uti dixit Isocrates in Ephoro et Theopompo, frenis eget, alter calcaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum frenis sed etiam jugo accepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum rege: qui nisi paret, Imperat: hunc frenis, hunc tu compesce catenā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam vaga prosiliet frenis natura remotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18754.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni frenum accipere et victi parere fatentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates tenere sub freno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 23 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18754.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">horse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques aptus frenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">portarumque moras frenis assultat et hastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:243" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 243</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18754.10" n="C" level="2"> In <cb n="FREQ" /> gen. </sense><sense id="n18754.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That which holds things together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a band</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">absiliunt pontes tectique trementis Saxea frena labant, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>the stone bands</tr>, <tr>ties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:880" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 880</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18754.12" n="2" level="3"> In anatomy: <cit><quote lang="la">frenum,</quote> <trans><tr>the ligament which attaches the inside of the foreskin to the glans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 25, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
frequens: <entryFree id="n18755" type="main" key="fre^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">frĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">frak-, fra/ssw</foreign>, to enclose, make close; Lat. farcio, fartilis, etc.; cf. Germ. Berg, Burg</etym>, <sense id="n18755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that takes place repeatedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">often</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">frequently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequent</hi> (class.; syn.: celeber, creber). </sense><sense id="n18755.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18755.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">that is often at a place</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">that often does a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeated</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduus, creber, multus): erat ille Romae frequens, in foro et in ore omnium cottidie versabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibuscum si frequentes sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 80</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod filium frequentiorem prope cum illis quam secum cernebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 53, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes frequens fuit Platonis auditor,</quote> <trans><tr>an assiduous hearer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos autem in hoc genere (orationis) frequentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed in utroque frequentiores sunt poëtae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 60, 202</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">spectator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conviva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:98:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 98, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentem ad signa esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adesse senatui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ore frequens posteritatis eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:6:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens te audivi atque affui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic hominum casus lenire et demere fatis Jura frequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:706" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 706</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18755.3" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">repeated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi frequentem operam dedistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(senectus) caret epulis exstructisque mensis et frequentibus poculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentiores (lactucae) in cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentes litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iambus et trochaeus frequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(verbum igitur) cum apud alios sit etiam frequens, apud alios numquam reperiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera (= assidua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=99" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 99</bibl>: frequentiora latrocinia, Asin. Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparationis usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentior usus anulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fuit alia gemma apud antiquos usu frequentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 7, 31, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentior fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: sententia, <hi rend="ital">held</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adopted by many</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens apud Graecos adagium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id frequentius est, quam ut exemplis confirmandum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 75</bibl></cit>;
